Academic.desc:
The mission of ACE is to facilitate active group study to foster academic achievement and social development among undergraduate engineering students. Further, this organization will exist to:
1.	Assist each member to achieve his or her own academic potential
2.	Provide students with the environment to build lasting relationships with other engineering students
3.	Create a medium in which students can develop their leadership and team problem-solving skills
4.	Encourage students to establish connections with faculty and alumni of the engineering department.
Academic.name: Academic Connection of Engineers (ACE)

Academic.desc: To serve UCSD chemistry majors by providing a friendly environment for the intellectual exploration of relevant industrial chemistry and chemical research topics. We aim to provide students interested in science with networking, outreach and volunteering opportunities that will help them define their goals, choose their career path and pursue their intended career.
Academic.name: American Chemical Society Student Affiliates (ACSSA)

Academic.desc: To provide an arena for discussions in Anthropology and promote participation in the field.
Academic.name: Anthropology Club

Academic.desc: The purpose of this organization is to create a network of support for former AVID students attending UCSD as well as accommodate other UC San Diego students. The UCSD AVID Alumni Association will uphold AVID’s mission statement by preparing all students for a successful transition into our global society. The AVID Alumni Association hopes to fulfill its mission by providing service, professional networking, increasing college persistence rates, and engaging in effective collaborations and partnerships with school and community organizations. We plan on establishing a figurative bridge that will make the transition the University of California, San Diego less difficult for incoming freshmen, while also providing upperclassmen with the resources they need to be successful in their respective college and career aspirations.
Academic.name: AVID Alumni Association

Academic.desc:
The Bioengineering Graduate Society (BEGS) aims to be an interface for
bioengineering graduate students at UC San Diego, their department, and the local
community. Since its creation in 1994, the BEGS mission is to foster professional,
educational, and social development opportunities through relationships with industry,
alumni, and students. BEGS is a graduate student-run organization with the aid of the
Bioengineering Department.
Academic.name: Bioengineering Graduate Society

Academic.desc: With nearly 20 percent of the UCSD undergraduate population declared as biology majors, the Biological Sciences Student Association (BSSA) plays a crucial role in expanding opportunities and enhancing the overall educational and social experiences of these students during their time here. In addition, BSSA assists in preparing students for a wide range of career opportunities.
Academic.name: Biological Sciences Student Association

Academic.desc:
The Biological Sciences Scholars Program (BSSP) is committed to promoting excellence in scholarship, service, and leadership among the Biological Sciences Scholars and the UCSD community.
BSSP is a learning community dedicated to providing undergraduate students:
support for student transition to UCSD and the Biology community
establishing a connection with biology peers
exploration of issues and opportunities in the sciences and professions
understanding of the diversity of UCSD and the field of science
opportunities to enhance leadership skills
guidance to resources and faculty to assist students on their science journey
Academic.name: BioScholars Program (formerly Biological Science Scholars Program)

Academic.desc:
The mission of  Chemistry Peer Advisory League (ChemPAL) is to provide mentoring to undergraduate students studying Chemistry and opportunities to serve as mentors for graduate students in the Chemistry & Biochemistry Department. The group focuses on supporting first generation undergraduate students and other minority students who are majoring in chemistry, though is not exclusive to those groups. Small mentoring groups matching graduate student mentors with undergraduate mentees meet throughout the academic year to support the undergraduate mentees. Additionally, group-wide quarterly events are hosted to foster community. Other opportunities, such as lab tours and science demos may also be hosted to promote a more collective excitement for chemistry. 

Objectives:
ChemPAL seeks to build a welcoming and encouraging community for all undergraduates considering degrees and careers in Chemistry, Biochemistry, or related fields.
ChemPAL mentoring groups will help mentees find their confidence and passion in Chemistry & Biochemistry.
ChemPAL will help undergraduate students grow a professional network by forging stronger connections to fellow students and graduate students.
Academic.name: Chemistry Peer Advisory League (ChemPAL)

Academic.desc: Aid Cognitive Science student body through academic, professional, and social means;  Engage graduate population and faculty.

Academic.desc: It is our organization’s philosophy to involve our members in a holistic application of undergraduate neuroscience. Members will have the opportunity to listen to keynote speakers, explore undergraduate research, and improve the San Diego community through neuro-focused academic outreach and local volunteering. Ultimately, we aim to provide the our members with a means to engage neuroscience outside of the classroom.

Academic.desc: The purpose and aim of the Computer Science and Engineering Society is to provide an opportunity for interested students to investigate the basis of engineering and programming.

Academic.desc: The Data Science Student Society at UCSD is an interdisciplinary academic organization designed to immerse the community in the diverse and growing facets of Data Science: Machine Learning, Computational Statistics, Data Mining, Visualization, Predictive Analytics, and any new emerging relevant fields of study. With practical hands-on data projects, a professional portfolio-building approach, and fun outreach activities, the Data Science Student Society at UCSD strives to enrich the academic life of the student community by strengthening them for success in their current and future pursuits of Data Science related fields.

Academic.desc: The American Astronautical Society and American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics have organized an annual student design-build-launch competition for space-related topics. CanSat is an annual competition that requires each team to design, build, and launch a payload/deployment system that will satisfy a set of challenging mission requirements. The Design, Build, Launch (DBL) team at UCSD strives to further each member's understanding of engineering topics and deepen their passion for engineering. We are a small project, where each member's contributions will be recognized and valued. We aim to build the best cansat with hands-on expertise and self-taught technical knowledge.

Academic.desc: The ECE Undergraduate Student Council (UGSC) is the voice of Electrical and Computer Engineering (ECE) undergraduate students at UCSD. Through networking, programming, leadership, & relevant education, the council strives to effect change within the department & campus at large, building a stronger & longer-lasting community for current & future engineers. The UGSC is committed to carrying out ECE’s mission statement of educating tomorrow’s technology leaders.

The Chapter also seeks to host professional and outreach events in collaboration with other on campus organizations as well as corporate and community partners.

More information about the national Material Advantage organization may be found online:  http://materialadvantage.org/

Our club consists of quarterly meetings, group attendance to conferences, discussion about graduate programs, creation of study groups, and educational outreach activities for the disadvantaged. For more information or questions contact us at uwip.ucsd@gmail.com

Our purpose is to provide opportunities for students with a desire to pursue

Academic.desc:
The ‘WEarables TECHnologies@UCSD’, abbreviated as ‘WeTECH@UCSD’, is a student group that aims to be a common platform for the students and individuals from the UC San Diego and the local community who are interested in the field of wearable devices. 

Wearables have garnered tremendous interest not only in the academic sections but also in industry with giant Tech companies like, Google, Apple, Microsoft etc actively working in this exciting field. With an expected compound annual growth rate of 35% over the next five years, the global wearables market is poised to reach 148 million annual shipments in 2019. UC San Diego is actively involved in development of various technologies related to wearables. Several groups in diverse departments, such as, Electrical & Computer Engineering, NanoEngineering, Bioengineering, Computer Science Engineering and CaliIT2 are working on various challenging aspects of this technology. ‘WeTECH@UCSD’ will strive to bring students who are actively involved in wearables related research and also students who wish to explore the field on a common forum to identify new avenues for inter-disciplinary research. The organization will encourage events and discussion about research that relates to wearables, for example, printed and conventional electronics, fabrication processes, novel materials, software development, power sources, product design etc. 

The organization has four core initiatives: 1) outreach, 2) community building, 3) continuing ed
Academic.name: WEarable TECHnologies@UCSD

Academic.desc: The purpose of the organization is to provide an academic, professional and career-supportive environment to graduate students in Bioengineering. The organization will strive to facilitate career and professional events to benefit the potential career path of its members. The organization may co-sponsor and participate in on-campus and outreach activities with other campus and community groups, as appropriate. Women in Bioengineering is a non-profit student organization.

Furthermore, we open this space to people who would like to add to the space while at the same time dismantle hierarchies. The Che Cafe Collective organizes numerous political and social events for all ages and allows vegan groups to serve tasty vegan food.

The objectives of the Black Graduate Student Association1 are
(1) to support a network of individuals dedicated to the advancement of African-American and black

Cultural.desc: It is the purpose of the Brazilian Student Association to represent and empower the Brazilian community in the University and its surroundings, to establish solid relationships with other universities and to form partnerships with the social, political, corporate and industrial sectors of Brazilian society. Our association also has as its mission to spread Brazilian culture and lifestyle by providing a comfortable environment and social network for members as well as all others interested in Brazilian culture. The Brazilian Student Association is a non-profit cultural, social and professional organization striving to promote the Brazilian culture as well as serving the above-mentioned purpose around UCSD campus and its surrounding environment.

Cultural.desc: We, a non-profit organization called the Cambodian Student Association (CSA) of the University of California, San Diego (UCSD), believe that by (1) building and strengthening identification of the Cambodian culture among fellow members, students and community at large, (2) offering consistent academic, social and moral encouragement through activities and community service and (3) developing social networks that will assist us during our time in college and in our lives thereafter, we will have established rare relationships and support systems based on common principles and values with fellow members who share common interests.

Cultural.desc: The purpose of CASA is to connect students through the middle eastern culture and expand their views on the essence of what it means to be a Chaldean-American. Cultural.desc: The Druze Student Association (DSA) at UCSD seeks to provide Druze students with a venue to come together and promote their culture on campus as well as educate the school community about one of the world’s smallest ethno-religious groups. Cultural.desc: The FUSION Hip-Hop Dance Events Association is a student organization involved in the cultural, social, community, and academic projects that benefit its members, its campus, and its community. FHHDEA aims to recognize excellence in the UCSD hip-hop dance community, west cost dance communities, support dancers, and provide performance opportunities for dance to be shared among dancers and audiences all over the nation and beyond.

Cultural.desc: Hermanas Unidas is a Latina based organization that focuses primarily on academics, community service, and collegial networking. The motto symbolizes the strength and will of each and every Hermana in their quest for higher education, the empowerment of their families and communities, as well as equality in education, the workplace and the rest of society.

Cultural.desc:
Hermanos Unidos de UC San Diego will strive to create a welcoming and empowering brotherhood or “hermandad” amongst its members. Hermanos Unidos de UC San Diego will strive to attain this goal by embracing the three foundational pillars, which are stated in the Hermanos Unidos Constitution.

“The three foundational pillars of Hermanos Unidos are Academic Scholarship, Community Service, and Social Networking. Academic Scholarship reflects the primary reason why an Hermano attends an institution of higher learning: to receive a quality education. Community Service represents an Hermano’s commitment to community involvement. Social Networking will seek to make the transition from high school/ community college to undergraduate life less traumatic and more meaningful for incoming Hermanos. Fulfilling the three pillars leads to the development of partnerships and alliances necessary for successfully accomplishing the mission of Hermanos Unidos. Thus, all three pillars should be approached with equal amount of concern, time, and intensity”
-HU Constitution.
Cultural.name: Hermanos Unidos de UCSD

Cultural.desc: Our vision is to promote the welfare of the Cantonese-speaking Chinese student body. We also provide a social environment for those who want to stay in touch with the Chinese culture as well as those who want to find acceptance and sense of belonging in the States.

Cultural.name: Korean American Student Association

Cultural.desc: Ko.SCA (Korean Student Cultural Association) helps all Korean people to get used to UCSD well. Ko.SCA also introduces Korean culture.
Cultural.name: Korean Student Cultural Association (KO.SCA )

Cultural.desc: LSC is a club for those who are Lebanese and non-Lebanese interested in uniting and promoting the culture. We are a non-political, non-religious campus organization interested in expanding the appreciation of Lebanon and its culture through networking and social events.
Cultural.name: Lebanese Social Club

Cultural.desc: 1.	Lion Dance at UCSD is established for the purpose of providing cultural enrichment to UCSD and San Diego area by practicing, performing, and teaching the ancient art of Chinese Lion Dancing. 2.	Lion Dance at UCSD intends to perform for any UCSD affiliated groups and events as well as non-UCSD affiliated organizations interested in our presentation. 3.	Lion Dance at UCSD is a Not-For-Profit organization, and will rely on donations, contributions, and other forms of fundraising to finance equipment.
Cultural.name: Lion Dance at UCSD

Cultural.desc:
The purpose of this cultural organization shall be to introduce Malaysian culture to all UCSD students as well as facilitate events for Malaysians students studying at UCSD;

Facilitate events such as but not limited to:
a.	An organization aimed at encouraging conversation and bonding with new incoming Malaysian students and returning Malaysian students,
b.	Provide a sense of home for Malaysians studying abroad at UCSD,
c.	For Malaysian students who seek it, assistance with assimilation in American culture,
d.	Arrange events to introduce Malaysian culture and customs to other UCSD students (food, games, and traditional celebrations),
e.	Collaborate with other Malaysian Student Associations around the United States of America to form academic, social, and professional relationships;

Malaysians in America (MIA) at UCSD is a non-profit student run cultural organization that will be financed through:
a.	Associated Students funding,
b.	External donations and charity,
c.	MIA fundraisers;
Cultural.name: Malaysians in America at UCSD

Cultural.desc: As a Cultural/Social organization, we aim to promote and spread the idea that Asians are not just a single group of people, but are made up of many individuals from various and distinct cultural backgrounds. We hope to share these cultural values to the UCSD community by providing a fun and welcoming, stereotype-free, and all-inclusive social atmosphere for students.
Cultural.name: Multi-Asian Student Association

Cultural.desc: To allow Japanese American, Japanese and any other interested student to interact in a socially conductive environment. To promote awareness of Japanese American and Japanese culture, history and issues on the UCSD campus. To provide a link between the Japanese American community on the UCSD campus and the Japanese American community in the areas surrounding UCSD.
Cultural.name: Nikkei Student Union

Cultural.desc: The purpose of this cultural Association is to inform all interested persons of the customs and traditions of Pakistani culture, to further the knowledge of interested persons of the history of Pakistan, and to serve all UCSD and other University Students, Faculty and Staff, including International Students, in achieving the above stated goals.
Cultural.name: Pakistani Student Association

Cultural.desc:
The Persian Association for Rendering Science and Art (PARSA) at UCSD is a non-profit organization and independent of any political or religious beliefs.  Activities of PARSA includes following purposes:
 
  I. Increase the general public awareness regarding Persian Art and Science
 II. Promote the Iranian/Iranian-American young and senior scientists and artists
III. Bring Iranian/Iranian-American Scientist and Artist on-campus towards fostering young talents and show casing for general awareness.
Cultural.name: PARSA

Cultural.desc: To serve as a platform for amateur pianists at UCSD to interact with their peers and share our passion for piano music.
Cultural.name: Piano Society at UCSD

Cultural.desc:
QuEST (Queer Engineers, Scientists and Technical Professionals) seeks to advance the career and well being of LGBTQ individuals in the science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) fields. To this end, the goals of this group are to:
a) provide opportunities for mentorship and networking for LGBTQ individuals in STEM careers at all levels
b) improve the retention of LGBTQ individuals in STEM fields by increasing visibility and by fostering a supportive community  
c) encourage more LGBTQ individuals to enter STEM fields through outreach projects
Cultural.name: Queer Engineers, Scientists and Technical Professionals

Cultural.desc:
The purposes of the Raza Graduate Student Association (RGSA) are to:
1)	increase unity among graduate students of color, particularly Latin@/Chicana@ students, at UCSD
2)	promote graduate education to Latin@/Chicana@ undergraduate student populations, and recruit them for graduate school at UCSD
3)	provide a community, resources, and a social network for graduate students of color at UCSD
	(RGSA is a not-for-profit organization.)
Cultural.name: Raza Graduate Student Association

Cultural.desc: To promote Indonesian culture to University of California, San Diego community through social and other non­profit events. To create camaraderie between the members. To build a network with other Indonesian clubs.
Cultural.name: San Diego Indonesian Association

Cultural.desc: UC San Diego's largest South Asian organization, SangamSD aspires to promote South Asian cultural awareness and education within the UCSD community and beyond. SangamSD's goals of uniting South Asians at UCSD as well as spreading diversity, tolerance, and the understanding of all South Asian cultures is reflected through its numerous social, cultural, and educational events.
Cultural.name: SangamSD

Cultural.desc: It is the mission of SCA at UCSD to promote knowledge and awareness of Saudi culture through cultural and social forum within UCSD community and within greater San Diego area. It is to the soul of this association to encourage cultural dialog and understanding of cultural differences for the sake of harmony and cooperation among UCSD society and greater San Diego societies.
Cultural.name: Saudi Cultural Association at UCSD

Cultural.desc: The purpose of this association shall be a non-profit organization for pharmacy students at the UCSD Skaggs School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences with an interest in music dedicated to providing relief to patients in hospitals and other health settings through music.
Cultural.name: Serotones

Cultural.desc:
Sitaare is UCSD’s premiere coed South Asian a cappella group. 
Since 2006 we have engaged in light-hearted vocal mischief, performing and competing at numerous events such as UC Berkeley's Anahat A Capella competition, University of Iowa's Gathe Raho competition, and various community events in the San Diego area including UCSD Sangam’s annual South Asian culture show. Our repertoire consists mainly of South Asian pop and film music, along with the occasional English R&B; or pop piece.
Cultural.name: Sitaare

Cultural.desc: The Asian Pacific American Medical Students Association (APAMSA) is a national organization of medical and pre-medical students committed to addressing the unique health challenges of Asian and Pacific Islander American (APIA) communities. APAMSA serves as a forum for student leaders to engage these health issues and develop initiatives and projects addressing those needs. The local, regional, and national activities of APAMSA aim to promote the health of the APIA community and help healthcare workers understand how to care for APIA patients in a culturally sensitive manner. Finally, APAMSA provides an important venue for medical students to meet, exchange experiences, and develop personally and professionally through leadership and service.
Cultural.name: SOM APAMSA at UCSD

Cultural.desc: Society for Promotion of Indian Classical Music And Culture Amongst Youth (SPICMACAY) is a non-profit student organization that aims to preserve and promote the rich, diverse traditions of Indian culture, while encouraging youth participation. By offering programs in classical music, dance, yoga, crafts, and meditation, along with opportunities to interact with artists and volunteer in local Indian cultural events, SPICMACAY serves as a vital link to Indian traditions for youth.
Cultural.name: Spicmacay

Cultural.desc:
The Taiwanese American Students Association (TASA) at the University of California – San Diego is an organization that provides a sense of community for Taiwanese Americans, as well as those interested in the Taiwanese culture. We create a sense of unity not only within the Taiwanese community here in San Diego, but also with students at other universities.

Our organization promotes cultural awareness by building a community of motivated and dedicated students through our social, cultural, an
Cultural.name: Taiwanese American Student Association

Cultural.desc: For the first time ever, on April 9th, 2016, mayhem will be taking over sunny San Diego. TamashaSD is a student run organization on the UC San Diego campus that aims to connect South Asian Americans back to their roots while fostering a positive cultural environment for the community. Eight Bollywood-Fusion dance teams will showcase their talent from across the nation and have the chance to compete for a first place prize. Get ready to experience amazing ocean views, unforgettable sunsets and tasty street tacos. Most of all, don’t forget to stay classy San Diego.
Cultural.name: TamashaSD

Cultural.desc:
As a cultural organization, the Thai Student Union (TSU) strives to
strengthen the bond of the Thai community in San Diego while sharing the Thai
culture with those outside of the Thai community.
Cultural.name: Thai Student Union (TSU)

Cultural.desc: Triton Foreign Film Society (TFFS) is a non-profit student organization that seeks to promote multiculturalism and bridge the gap between U.S. and international students by viewing and discussing international films.
Cultural.name: Triton Foreign Film Society

Cultural.desc: Tritons for Israel is the Pro-Israel student organization at UCSD. We are dedicated to raising awareness about Israel and Israeli culture, educating students, and promoting peace in the Middle East.
Cultural.name: Tritons For Israel

Cultural.desc: To promote Turkish culture and improve communication and cooperation among Turkish students at UCSD.
Cultural.name: Turkish Student Association

Cultural.desc: To address the needs of the Jewish community on campus and to provide framework for pluralistic Jewish life on campus through social, cultural, religious, and educational programming. The Union of Jewish Students is a non-profit organization.
Cultural.name: Union of Jewish Students

Cultural.desc: To strengthen the relationship between Muslim and Jewish Students.
Cultural.name: United

Cultural.desc: United Taiwanese Association was created to promote the Taiwanese culture through a number of traditional and cultural events that are representative of Taiwan. These events also sought to provide a sense of familiarity and home for students that have recently immigrated to the United States from Taiwan. UTA also hosts a number of social events on top of its cultural events to serve as the bridge for its diverse members group.
Cultural.name: United Taiwanese Association

Cultural.desc: To promote and preserve the Vietnamese culture and awareness among the UCSD students through various cultural, social, community, and educational events
Cultural.name: Vietnamese Student Association

Cultural.desc: The purpose of Youth Cultural Enrichment is for its members to provide cultural enrichment, especially of the Iranian cultural and religious heritage to the San Diego community and more specifically, the Youth.
Cultural.name: Youth Cultural Enrichment

Dance.desc: [N]Motion is Nikkei Student Union's (NSU) modern/hiphop dance team. As an all-inclusive dance team, [N]Motion aims to be a platform for students who have interests in dance but not much dance experience to pursue dance in a supportive environment and connect with San Diego's dance community. [N]Motion invites everyone of all skill levels who is interested in dance to perform at NSU's annual culture show.
Dance.name: [N]Motion Dance Team

Dance.desc: Established in 2010, 4N01 is an all female hip hop dance group based in San Diego. We don't have a specific style, but our team is a group of diverse dancers who come from different backgrounds with different skills, talents and experience levels. Our set represents our love, passion and diversity. We don't focus on how good you are when you start, but how hard you work to get better.
Dance.name: 4N01

Dance.desc: To build and sustain a community that gathers to practice and promote Argentine Tango at UCSD.
Dance.name: Argentine Tango Club

Dance.desc: To bring together the interests and passion for hip hop dance with the undergraduate students of UCSD.
Dance.name: Ascension Hip Hop Dance Team

Dance.desc: To engage members in a cultural understanding of Mexican Folk dance.
Dance.name: Ballet Folklorico la Joya de Mexico

Dance.desc: Body Rock at UCSD is a student organization that strives not only to bring together the breaking community through dance and music, but also to provide the space for bboys and bgirls to develop their breaking skills and for those who want to learn about the elements of breaking in hip hop culture.
Dance.name: Breakin' Club- Body Rock

Dance.desc: To enrich the student community of UCSD with the awareness of Chinese culture through the art of dance. Our purpose is to create an atmosphere of artistic and creative expression for everyone. CDA practices Chinese dance with emphasis on ballet techniques, but continues to keep the essence of Chinese culture in the pieces. In order to spread multi-cultural acknowledgemnt, CDA uses dance to celebrate the individual creativity and artistic collaboration.
Dance.name: Chinese Dance Association

Dance.desc: In the 16 years since DRP was formed, the team has performed at numerous competitions including Boston Bhangra, Bruin Bhangra, Dhol Di Awaz, VIBC, So-Cal Bhangra, and Best of the Best. Placing at many competitions, DRP has raised awareness of Punjabi culture not only in Southern California, but all over the United States. Through hard work, dedication, and determination, DRP hopes to continue to spread its love and respect for bhangra for years to come.
Dance.name: Da Real Punjabiz

Dance.desc: Our purpose is to provide an outlet for dancers who come to college seeking to continue their passion for dance in addition to pursuing higher education as UCSD does not offer this. Our contemporary based dance company will hold various showcases/events to allow our members to express themselves through artistic movement. Our main goal is to offer an escape for students who wish to further build upon their talent and creativity, as well as forming a united family.
Dance.name: Finesse Dance Company

Dance.desc: Mission Statement: Established in 2014, Kidz Next Door is an exhibition hip-hop dance group based in UCSD. Created with the purpose to inspire others in the dance community, the group spreads their passion for dance through performances and workshops. Although the group's focus is built around the style of hip hop, many diverse styles and backgrounds are represented through the individual dancers such jazz, contemporary, salsa, etc. The Kidz Next Door Leadership pushes the group members to grow not only as dancers but as a family, encouraging them to respect one another as well as the community around them.
Dance.name: Kidz Next Door

Dance.desc: KOTX is a K-pop dance team that entertains and spreads Korean culture through K-pop. Creating a welcoming environment for all K-pop lovers and is open to all levels of dancers. LET'S GET KOTX!
Dance.name: KOTX

Dance.desc: The Purpose of Poptikz is to foster a community of Poppers at UCSD. This involves informing individuals about the etiquettes of battling, the foundations of popping, related substyles of Popping, and expression through music. Poptikz aims to show Popping in its street, freestyle form through cyphers and battles. The integrity of Popping should not be compromised, and a positive vibe should be upheld
Dance.name: Poptikz

Dance.desc: To explore and promote Indian classical dance forms such as bharatanatyam, kuchipudi, kathak, odissi, and mohiniattam at UCSD.
Dance.name: Pushpanjali

Dance.desc: The competitive Garba and Raas team at UCSD is a non-profit, recreational club with a cultural twist. This group promotes Garba and Raas, two interrelated West-Indian dance forms that originated from the state of Gujarat. In this day and age, Garba & Raas have been transformed from the deeply traditional precursors to the more energetic, contemporary form that is practiced by this team. In addition to simply developing and performing modern Garba/Raas choreography on campus, this team intends to partake in national, collegiate Garba/Raas competitions, thereby representing the University of California, San Diego and promoting school pride. At the local level, this seems also seeks to promote cultural and social awareness of this dance form and the related cultural connotation by performing on campus, and at nearby universities, as well as by eliciting participation from the student body. An implicit goal of this organization is to build a community at UC San Diego for all students who dance for the team and wish to be involved.
Dance.name: Raas Ruckus Dance Team at UCSD

Dance.desc: The Salsa Club at UC San Diego is a non-profit organization offering Salsa dance instruction to the student population at large (undergraduate, graduate, part-time, full-time), faculty, staff, and alumni. We hope to create a fun social group that will foster a life-long appreciation for dancing in general. We also seek to enrich the UCSD campus life by providing an affordable and entertaining outlet for students to learn about Salsa dancing
Dance.name: Salsa Club at the University of California San Diego

Dance.desc: To help UCSD dancers develop discipline, spiritual maturity, and lasting friendships through the creation of innovative performances.  As time passes, hopefully the members who are on the Spoon Project can become well-versed in choreography and freestyling, as well as teaching these aspects back to the dance community.
Dance.name: Sleepless Collective

Dance.desc:
Swing Club at UCSD Constitution


Purpose: 
To provide a safe and fun place for people to discuss and practice the art of swing dancing and make friends.

Swing Club at UCSD is a non-profit student organization.

Requirements for membership:
Membership is open to all students at UCSD, undergraduate, and graduate. There are no fees. All that is required to become a member is to attend one meeting per quarter and to sign up for the emailing list at swingUCSD@gmail.com. A person should request to give up membership by asking to be removed from the emailing list by emailing swingUCSD@gmail.com. 

Frequency of Organization Meetings:
Swing Club meetings will occur once a week for three hours, for all three quarters of the academic year.
Dance.name: Swing Club at UCSD

Dance.desc:
The Triton Twirl Flag Squad is a nonprofit, student-run organization which promotes school spirit at UCSD.  We perform at various events at UCSD, such as basketball half-time shows and the Sungod Festival.

Our squad takes pride in being an all inclusive organization. Anyone is welcome to take part in our yearly auditions, including those without prior experience.
Dance.name: Triton Twirl Flag Squad

Dance.desc: To explore and express aspects of South Asian culture through Bollywood Dance.
Dance.name: Zor at UCSD (Hindi Film) Dance Team

Educational.desc: The purpose of the Academic Integrity Peer Educators is to have students involved in advocating for the importance of Academic Integrity at the University/College and High School levels. The Peer Educators will help UCSD students who have allegedly violated our policy on Integrity of Scholarship go through the administrative process and learn from the experience; they will help all UCSD students to understand the importance of academic and professional integrity and to practice skills at acting ethically and will assist in creating a culture where integrity is an expected and valued norm. The Academic Integrity Peer Educators is a non­profit organization.
Educational.name: Academic Integrity Peer Educators

Educational.desc: Active Minds at UC San Diego is a non-profit, student run mental health awareness, education and advocacy organization on campus. Through our programs, events and collaborations, we will seek to promote mental health awareness on campus and the overall psychological well-being of UC San Diego students. Our vision, mission and values will guide our activities.
Educational.name: Active Minds

Educational.desc: Basic Life Support Program is a prestigious program established in 2014 that specializes in instructing Basic Life Support (BLS) through the American Heart Association and certifying individuals that complete the course. This program is a committee within the Alpha Epsilon Delta honor society that allows the acquirement of not only profit, leadership experience, and the growth of the organization, but ultimately provides a concrete difference between Alpha Epsilon Delta and other health related organizations.
Educational.name: Basic Life Support Program

Educational.desc: We, the Coalition for Critical Asian American Studies (CAAS), are a non-profit, student-run committee whose main purpose shall be advocating and strengthening critical Asian American studies at the University of California at San Diego.  We understand that “Asian American” is not a racial identity but a political one--one that marks us not by how we look but how we believe.  It is through this understanding that we are able to create diverse coalitions which draw unity not through uniformity.
Educational.name: Coalition for Critical Asian American Studies

Educational.desc: The CAPS Wellness  Peer Education Program is a non-profit organization that seeks to provide educational and outreach opportunities to members of the UCSD community and beyond. We recognize the value of peer support in helping students address personal concerns.  Through peer education, we hope to help students recognize their resources as well as increase prevention of mental illness and decrease the stigmas associated with utilizing the Counseling and Psychological Services.
Educational.name: Counseling and Psychological Services Peer Education Program

Educational.desc:
To educate and preserve DJ culture and electronic music culture.
To expose the art behind DJing.
To produce quality DJs based on talent, individuality, and fundamentals.
Educational.name: DeeJays and Vinylphiles Club

Educational.desc: The purpose of divE is to promote diversity, ingenuity, and collaboration among student scientists and engineers through an integrated engineering environment based on team projects.
Educational.name: DivE

Educational.desc: The Energy Club seeks to build a community of students and professionals to analyze and understand the most pressing global energy challenges. To accomplish this we will focus on interdisciplinary programs to bring together members of the engineering, science, policy and business communities. Through these events we hope to provide members with a well-rounded, extensive knowledge of the issues and application of the energy landscape and foster potentially unique solutions.
Educational.name: Energy Club at UCSD

Educational.desc: Our purpose is to learn about feminist theory through the writings and literature of feminist scholars. The Feminist Book Club will serve to open up a dialogue about intersectional feminism, covering a wide range of topics, including, but not limited to: race, gender, sexuality, class, ability, and ethnicity. This club will be an inclusive, safe space for all participants.
Educational.name: Feminist Book Club

Educational.desc: To advocate and promote foster youth awareness. We want to create a safe environment not only for foster youth but to also neglected students who felt they never had parents. We want to be able to relate to one another and create a personal relationship that we cannot create with other students outside this organization.
Educational.name: Foster the Students

Educational.desc: GUIDE works to inform and engage the Greek community on matters of historical inequality within and outside the University of California, San Diego. GUIDE shall work with each of the three Greek councils, as well as individual chapters and members therein, to educate and provide resources for the Greek community with regards to matters of equity, diversity and inclusion (EDI), and to ultimately advocate for a Greek community characterized by justice and equality for all.
Educational.name: Greeks United for Inclusivity, Diversity, and Equity (GUIDE)

Educational.desc: The purpose of HOLOS is to explore in depth various healing and restorative practices native to a variety of cultures from around the world in order to provide students with alternative methods of stress management and maintenance of overall well- being.
Educational.name: HOLOS : Healing Our Lives of Stress

Educational.desc: Working to enhance the impact and efficiency of the sustainability community on campus, the Inter-Sustainability Council represents and connects various on-campus sustainability entities in order to increase awareness and education of sustainability and provide sustainable solutions that will maintain UC San Diego’s position as a leader in sustainability in the country and the world.
Educational.name: Inter-Sustainability Council

Educational.desc: The IPDL is excited to bring low-cost, low-commitment competitive debate to the UC San Diego community! Throughout the year, we host parliamentary debate workshops and tournaments to improve participants' oratory and argumentation skills and foster discussion regarding current, controversial topics.
Educational.name: Intramural Parliamentary Debate League at UCSD

Educational.desc: Promoting a cultivating environment for engineers to develop hands-on experience through structural engineering and architectural projects.
Educational.name: Keystone Engineering

Educational.desc: Connecting between companies and students so students could find jobs easily for their future.
Educational.name: Kojobs at UCSD

Educational.desc: Our purpose is to assemble a group of ambitious individuals, accompanied by their ideas, in order to open intellectual dialogues of the unexplored. Discussions will delve into a myriad of scientific topics. We aim to foster an environment where the ideas of passionate people can be shared. Through careful deliberation of students’ concepts, methods of improvement and experimentation will be exacted. All UCSD students are welcome to partake in the club’s educational discussions.
Educational.name: Launch Tank

Educational.desc: The LGBTQIA at UCSD is committed to providing safe spaces for the LGBTQIA community. We work at this goal in many ways: holding regular meetings and office hours to provide a space to talk and socialize; putting on dances open to all, allowing people to have a good time without fear; holding rallies to show our Pride; and promoting education, both within the LGBTQIA community and to the larger San Diego community.
Educational.name: Lesbian Gay Bisexual Transgender Queer Intersex Association

Educational.desc:
LAIT ("light") is a newly founded Animal Rights Organization at UC San Diego!

We are an inspired, warm, and welcoming community of UC San Diego students that is dedicated to educating UCSD at large, and the greater community, on the issues of animal exploitation, while inspiring people to have compassion for all animals. Focusing on animals exploited for food, clothing, entertainment and testing, we encourage and empower people to take action and speak up against injustice and violence.

We challenge speciesism, and the notion that some beings are more worthy of respect than others. We believe that, just like the value of someone’s life does not depend on their race, gender, or sexual orientation, the value of someone's life also does not depend on their species. We all deserve respect, and the right to be safe, happy, and free.

We envision a world in which all life is respected and valued. A world where Animals, Humans, and Nature co-exist in harmony. And we feel empowered to help create such a world within our lifetimes.

We will hold educational events (documentary screenings, guest speakers etc.), fun social events (vegan pizza night/potluck, movie night, hiking, etc.) and activism events (tabling, non-violent protests, leafleting etc.), and more! We look forward to hearing your ideas!

Join us! Everyone is welcome!
Educational.name: Life for Animals, Inspiring Tritons (LAIT)

Educational.desc: We are a service based Student Organization devoted to providing our members with Medically related volunteer opportunities. Our members are paired with each other to create a care system in which specific questions or school assistance can be provided. We aim to connect our fellow students with their surrounding environments to bring companies and medically related schools to our campus. We wish to inform our students and hold work shops to help elevate their status and prepare them for a professional career. Through this we hope to achieve optimal success for our members and provide them with a dependable and personal network.
Educational.name: Medical Foundations

Educational.desc: Migrant Rights Awareness strives for change in our community so that all people regardless of immigration status are guaranteed absolute access to equal rights and opportunities and are perceived as being deserving of the same. Migrant Rights Awareness (MiRA) is committed to work to make the UCSD campus climate and community inclusive of the undocumented community on and off campus. We seek to promote the need and necessity of resources for undocumented students and students of mixed status families so that they are retained at the university level. Also MiRA strives make it so that UCSD is viewed as more accessible to students who identify as undocumented and may shy away from this university due to the demographic and geographical proximity to the US- Mexico Border and checkpoints.
Educational.name: Migrant Rights Awareness

Educational.desc: The purpose of Mock Trial at UCSD is to encourage interest in law advocacy and to prepare for Mock Trial competitions.
Educational.name: Mock Trial @ UCSD

Educational.desc: Model United Nations members simulate the United Nations by role-playing diplomats and forming delegations to attend conferences. At these conferences, students debate global issues, conduct speeches, draft resolutions, form political alliances, and resolve critical international problems. In doing so, Model United Nations students are exposed to international relations and its application in today's society, which expands their understanding of the world and becoming global citizens.
Educational.name: Model United Nations at UCSD

Educational.desc: Establish a community of music producers to network, collaborate, and throw events on campus.
Educational.name: Producers & Remixers Organization

Educational.desc: We are a student run garden aiming to create a vibrant and peaceful gathering place for interactive cooperative activities, community building, service-leading, social and environmental education.
Educational.name: Roger's Community Garden at UCSD

Educational.desc: The purpose of the Society is to honor undergraduate students’ achievement and empower them by providing powerful tools for success. Our goal is to maximize each student’s potential by providing meaningful connections to a vibrant peer and mentor community as well as a proprietary platform for developing necessary personal and academic skills.  We aim to inspire members to take control of their own futures, move toward independence, and ultimately, establish a foundation and foothold for successful careers and lives.
Educational.name: SCLA

Educational.desc: SENDforC San Diego is the San Diego branch of the non-profit organization Support, ENcourage, and Develop for Children, Inc. (referred to as SENDforC). SENDforC San Diego advocates STEM education and mentoring of high school students. Members of this club will serve as University Mentors and assist students to engineer solutions to everyday problems through playful and hands-on projects. SENDforC San Diego will implement the QDII curriculum developed by SENDforC Inc. to produce technological, social entrepreneurs.
Educational.name: SENDforC San Diego

Educational.desc: Student Health Advocates (SHAs) is an organization of trained student volunteers who educate other students about health issues and concerns and promote health and wellness in all areas of campus life.  These are two specialties within the Student Health Advocates program, General Health and Sexual Health.
Educational.name: Student Health Advocates

Educational.desc: Student Involvement Leadership Consultants, or SILCs, are bright, motivated UCSD students committed to sharing our leadership and involvement experience to serve the UCSD community on whole. Our mission is to provide the University of California, San Diego student organizations with direct services to assist in their operations and to provide the campus-wide student population with consultation regarding student involvement and leadership opportunities.
Educational.name: Student Involvement Leadership Consultant (SILC)

Educational.desc: This student organization seeks to educate the campus about mass incarceration (the Prison Industrial Complex) as a form of institutionalized racism. To do so, the group will provide a space to cultivate a culture of undergraduate student activism against the injustice in the U.S. prison system and cooperate with faculty and graduate students to spread awareness primarily through screenings, speakers, and panels.
Educational.name: Students Against Mass Incarceration

Educational.desc: Students for Integrative Medicine is a non-profit student organization committed to raising awareness on the topic of integrative medicine throughout UCSD and the San Diego community. Through collaborating with diverse groups of professionals SIM hopes to promote healthy life style choices and wellness by educating members as well as the community on the principles and practices of integrative holistic medicine.
Educational.name: Students for Integrative Medicine

Educational.desc: In accordance with democratic principles, to promote justice, human rights, and the right of self-determination for the Palestinian people.
Educational.name: Students for Justice in Palestine

Educational.desc: TED is an annual event that brings together the world's leading thinker and doers to share ideas that matter in any discipline - technology, entertainment, design, science, humanities, business, development. TEDx events are local, self organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like event. We hope to create a local forum for ideas within the community to inspire people to change their lives, their futures and ultimately the world.
Educational.name: TEDx@UCSD

Educational.desc: The Purpose of the club is to engage in engineering projects utilizing 3D printing as well as conducting research and educating about the technologies and capabilties of 3D Printing.
Educational.name: Triton 3D @ UCSD

Educational.desc: Triton Art is a student organization focused on engaging and educating the student body at UCSD in art. We want to be the bridge between UCSD students and the Visual Arts Department by holding monthly art talks/workshops, opportunities for students to display their artworks and by holding social events for students to have the ability to meet others with like-minded passions.
Educational.name: Triton Art

Educational.desc: Triton Competitive Robotics seeks to bring recognition to the robotics community at UC San Diego by competing in robotics competitions all over the nation. By holding a series of workshops every academic quarter, we further seek to educate our peers in relevant engineering topics. We also aim to foster innovation by undergraduates in the field of robotics by serving as an incubator for robotics projects. Got an idea for a robot? Pitch it to us and we could provide you with the resources necessary to bring your innovation to life!
Educational.name: Triton Competitive Robotics

Health Professions.desc: A pre-health honor society with the purpose of connecting future health professionals and recognizing their achievements in their pursuit of a career in health. Activities include volunteering, educational programs and speakers at bi-weekly meetings including doctors, nurses, patients, medical students, pharmaceutical students, and more.
Health Professions.name: Alpha Epsilon Delta Pre-Health Professional Honor Society

Health Professions.desc: UCSD AMSA pre-medical chapter is dedicated to providing valuable resources for pre-medical students here at UCSD, as well as presenting opportunities for involvement in the health-care community. This year, our chapter will also be partnering up with the UCSD Medical School chapter to provide mentoring and joint community activites for our pre-medical students. It will be a wonderful opportunity for students to learn what medical school is like and to make valuable connections with students who have already been through the rigorous admissions processes required for medical school.

We are dedicated to increasing health awareness and addressing the health concerns of the San Diego community.

Health Professions.desc: California Health Professional Student Alliance (CaHPSA) at UCSD aims to foster leadership and advocacy skills among health professional students to increase health equity, primarily through grassroot efforts, education and chapter growth, in support of comprehensive, guaranteed healthcare for all Californians. We work to create opportunities to network with professionals in an effort to engender a sense of professional responsibility among students to empower them to advocate for a health system change. We hope to educate students on the issues of the current healthcare system and inform them of more efficient healthcare models such as Single-Payer.

Health Professions.desc: The mission of the UCSD, Skaggs School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, Student Society of Health-System Pharmacists is to make students aware of pharmacy practice in health systems and the potential of this setting for expanding the base of pharmacy practice, provide information to students about career directions in and credentials needed for pharmacy practice in health systems.

Health Professions.desc: We are a pre-health undergraduate organization that is committed to providing support, guidance, and education in our pursuit for higher education in medicine. Our beliefs are deeply rooted in providing better health care for our underserved communities through service, empowerment, and improving access to culturally-competent health care.

Health Professions.desc: The UCSD Health and Medical Professions Preparation Program (HMP3) provides undergraduates with enriching experiences that will enhance their preparation for admission into professional school in the medical and other health professions. Through collaborations with the UCSD School of Medicine, faculty, community health care providers and others, HMP3 provides members with stimulating experiences designed to expand the mind and increase qualifications for entry into the health professions. HMP3 a
Health Professions.name: Health and Medical Professions Preparation Program (HMP3)

Health Professions.desc: Healthcare Opportunities Preparation & Empowerment at UCSD serves to assist underrepresented minority, first-generation, or financially disadvantaged students  become more aware of the various fields of healthcare available to them.

Health Professions.desc:
The International Health Collective (or IHC) is a UCSD student-run non-profit organization that establishes a temporary free clinic in communities that need medical help around the world.  Our first and primary goal is to assist underprivileged communities with free medical care, medicine, and health education to improve the prevalent illnesses seen in underdeveloped communities.  Our secondary goal at IHC is to provide undergraduate students with the resources necessary to pursue their interests in the health care.  These resources include first-hand experience in a public medical setting by personally assisting medical professionals. They also include seminars in which medical professionals of all specialties speak on personal experiences encountered in their field to give attendees choose which specialty to work toward.  
     The International Health Collective serves the communities surrounding a temporary clinic site in Tijuana, Mexico, which functions during three Saturdays per school quarter. IHC strives to diagnose, supply medication, and provide health education to members of the Tijuana community with free doctor consultation, pharmacy care, and seminars. To provide these efficiently and effectively, IHC utilizes passionate staff members, comprehensive medical recording systems, and an efficient clinic layout.  By coordinating emergency medical technicians, pharmacists, and medical doctors, as well as UCSD student volunteers, the entire staff of IHC is able t
Health Professions.name: International Health Collective

Our purpose is also to join our members for a lifetime of service to their communities as well as provide quality friendships during school and in the future. We would like to use the resources available through our school to aid us in providing health-oriented services and information to our community by hosting outreach events.

MBN seeks to improve the food choices made by its members and our relationship with food, as well as create and foster a supportive network of like-minded, health-conscious individuals. MBN aims to promote health, nutrition, and wellness at UCSD and in the
community by engaging in healing as a holistic approach: mentally(mind), physically (body) and dietary (nutrition).

As a pre-medical organization, we plan to educate  our members on health issues that pertain to the Asian community, provide them with resources and insights into medical school, the medical school application process through a mentorship program.

Health Professions.desc: UCSD is known for its strong emphasis in the sciences, and many students aim to pursue careers in the health sector. But there is more to health than getting an MD, PharmD, or DDS. There are dozens of other careers, and SEARCH is here to let you know about these other paths as well as the standard MD, PharmD, and DDS routes. We host a series of informational seminars, in which speakers from different careers in the healthcare world come to educate students on what they do, and how you can pursue similar careers in the future. For students pursuing MD, PharmD, and DDS degrees, we host informative sessions about current internship opportunities and certifications they can hold while still in college. For all undergrads interested in healthcare, come and learn about the different degrees you can get, which schools offer them, what your expected salaries could be, and how a career in health may interest you.

Martial Arts.desc:
Boxing. It shall be the purpose of UCSD Boxing to promote awareness and appreciation of the sport of boxing and its philosophy of discipline, integrity, and respect at UCSD by providing a comfortable environment and social network for members as well as all others interested in the culture of the sport of boxing. UCSD Boxing is first and foremost a combat sports
organization, and although social events may result from the endeavor to achieve this purpose, they are not the priority.
Martial Arts.name: Boxing at UCSD

Martial Arts.desc:
Judo is a Japanese martial sport derived from Ju-Jitsu, Karate, and wrestling. The founder of Judo, Jigoro Kano trimmed both dangerous and inefficient techniques from these sports, allowing for both elegant and safe combat. With continued refinement, a comprehensive grappling sport soon developed, and was eventually added to the Olympiad. The art stresses dynamic, elegant throws, upholding finesse and, as a fundamental principle, the achievement of maximum efficiency with minimal effort. Through traditional and modern training methods, members perfect the art, improve their fitness, and foster close relationships with each other. The purpose of the organization is to gather Judo enthusiasts, both new and experienced, to practice and appreciate the sport. The two central tenets of our organization are a focus on the perfection of our skills, and communal prosperity both on and off the mat.
     We intend on sparring under the current Olympic Judo rules, so to ensure the safety of members. Qualified referees, and members with first aid skills will be ever present at our meetings and practices. Official international Judo rules and regulations can be found at:  http://www.intjudo.eu/Rules
Martial Arts.name: Judo Club at UCSD

Martial Arts.desc: The Kendo Club at UCSD seeks to promote awareness and appreciation of the Japanese sport of kendo, through community outreach, school involvement, and intercollegiate competition.
