Panhellenic.name: Kappa Kappa Gamma
Order Of Omega

Panhellenic.desc: To oversee the 10 Panhellenic and 1 Affiliate Chapters within the Panhellenic Council. These chapters are: Alpha Chi Omega, Alpha Epsilon Phi, Alpha Omicron Pi, Chi Omega, Delta Delta Delta, Delta Gamma, Kappa Alpha Theta, Kappa Kappa Gamma, Phi Sigma Rho (Affiliate), Pi Beta Phi, and Sigma Kappa.
Panhellenic.name: Panhellenic Association

Panhellenic.desc: Phi Sigma Rho is a social sorority for women in engineering and engineering technology. Through Phi Sigma Rho, our sisters develop the highest standard of personal integrity, strive for academic excellence, and build friendships that will last a lifetime.
Panhellenic.name: Phi Sigma Rho

Panhellenic.desc: The purpose of Sigma Kappa Sorority is to unite its members in a bond of sincere friendship for the development of character and the promotion of social, philanthropic, and intellectual culture.
Panhellenic.name: Sigma Kappa Sorority

Political.desc: The purpose of the College Democrats, a non-profit organization, is to educate students about the philosophy of the Democratic Party, promote campus discussion of issues of concern to students and the nation at large, foster involvement in political movements and affect political change on a local, state and national level
Political.name: College Democrats at UCSD

Political.desc: The College Republicans at UCSD strive to enhance principles of the Republican Party in the UCSD community. We encourage the advancement of the Republican Party through aiding elections at all levels of government. Further we promote a forum for political discussion open to all viewpoints. We also seek to serve the UCSD community through various volunteer efforts. The College Republicans at UCSD aims to build leadership abilities in students to serve the community and party.
Political.name: College Republicans at UCSD

Political.desc: Ecopoli is an organization that caters to those who are interested in the Japanese economy, politics, history, and various social issues. We facilitate discussions through individual/group presentations, debates, and research projects. We also encompass relevant topics outside of Japan. Ecopoli is a non-profit organization under UC San Diego’s SOLO program
Political.name: Ecopoli

Political.desc:
We are a national organization fighting in our workplaces, communities, and campuses against the exploitation and injustices people face every day. The present capitalist system has failed. The UC system is being privatized and increasingly unaffordable to working class students and their families. Wages remain flat while the cost of living shoots through the roof. Those in power use race, gender, sexual orientation, ability, nationality, and other traits to divide the population at large and allow them free hand to exploit. Mass incarceration has destroyed whole communities.

The socialist transformation of society is the way forward. To end the capitalist destruction of the environment, to end labor exploitation, to devote the incredible wealth of the Earth to helping the billions in poverty. Socialist Alternative at UCSD stands together with campus unions, student organizations, and the community at large in opposition to campus administration and corporate hierarchy.
Political.name: Socialist Alternative at UCSD

Political.desc: The purpose of this organization is to promote the political revolution on campus, in the San Diego region, in California and across the United States and to help elect Bernie Sanders as President of the United States and people who promote his policies to other Local, State and Federal offices.
Political.name: Tritons for Bernie

Political.desc: We are Tritons unified in support of the candidacy of Hillary Rodham Clinton for the Democratic Party's nomination  and her general election campaign for President of the United States.
Political.name: Tritons for Hillary

Political.desc:
The mission of Young Americans for Liberty (University of California, San Diego Chapter)
is to train, educate, and mobilize the youth towards a more free society.

Our goal is to cast the leaders of tomorrow and reclaim the policies, candidates, and direction of our government, and spread the ideas of limited government, free markets, sound money, non-intervention, and maximum individual liberty at University of California, San Diego.
Political.name: Young Americans for Liberty (formerly known as College Libertarians)

Pre-Professional.desc: The American Advertising Federation at UCSD (Adwave) provides an educational and professional platform for students to develop their abilities for an advertising and/or marketing career. We aim to inspire and bring together the brightest and most creative minds at UCSD.
Pre-Professional.name: American Advertising Federation at UCSD (AdWave)

Pre-Professional.desc: To promote interest in the field of aeronautics and astronautics.
Pre-Professional.name: American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA)

Pre-Professional.desc: To provide chemical engineering students with the most beneficial experience at UCSD through industry, career-building, and social events. We seek to promote academic, social, and professional growth for the chemical engineering community.
Pre-Professional.name: American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE)

Pre-Professional.desc: We will provide students with opportunities to meet with members of the mechanical engineering community and offer involvement in our two main project teams, the Human Powered Submarine Team and the Sample Return Robot/Rover Team.
Pre-Professional.name: American Society of Mechanical Engineers

Pre-Professional.desc:
The APD Consulting Club at UCSD has the following objectives:
•	To inform graduate-level students about possible careers in consulting 
•	Prepare graduate-level students to attain consulting jobs
•	Provide a career building resource focused on consulting
•	Create an alumni network of advanced professional degree consultants from UCSD
Pre-Professional.name: APD Consulting Club at UCSD

Pre-Professional.desc: The purpose of the club is to provide a semi-professional environment for students of all fields to gain experience in working on a project in hopes of encouraging entrepreneurship, gaining experience in teamwork, exposing members to applications of creative software development and design, and developing skills of all fields by applying school lessons to a real world product.
Pre-Professional.name: Area 110

Pre-Professional.desc:
The Association of Energy Engineers is a 501(c) (6) nonprofit professional organization that specializes in training, membership development, chapter development, and certification for professionals practicing in the fields of energy management, renewable energy and green buildings. The goal of AEE is to foster cooperative action in advancing the common purposes of its members and to promote activities designed to enable the industry to be conducted with the greatest economy and efficiency.

The student chapter aims to follow the mission of the national chapter and creates networking opportunities for undergraduate students to interact with energy professionals.
Pre-Professional.name: Association of Energy Engineers

Pre-Professional.desc: To foster the growth of students interested in biomedical engineering through professional development and the mutual engaging of industry, alumni, and the local community.
Pre-Professional.name: Biomedical Engineering Society (BMES)

Pre-Professional.desc: Business Council is a non-profit organization created to connect the UC San Diego business community through the collaboration of organizations, students, faculty, and alumni by providing resources to foster the growth and development of professionalism.
Pre-Professional.name: Business Council

Pre-Professional.desc: Chem-E-Car Project aims to provide chemical engineering students with the opportunity to participate in a team-oriented hands-on design and construction of a small chemical powered model car. In addition, it helps increase awareness of the chemical engineering discipline among the general public, industry leaders, educators and other students.
Pre-Professional.name: Chem-E-Car Project

Pre-Professional.desc: The purpose of founding this organization is intended to construct a business society which is to help Chinese students to get more first hand information about their future career paths in the U.S.. The goal of this organization is to construct various network opportunities with professionals who possess specific background in business such as (Finance, Consulting, Accounting and Investment Banking.) in order to obsess abundant first-hand information. We are trying to bound the UCSD alumni circle and maximizing the utilities of it in order to make our graduates have grandiose future.  The organization will do the best to provide networking opportunities with people from different industries, resume workshops, mock interviews, panel discussion, scholar seminars and other activities for students who demonstrates the strong interest in related area.
Pre-Professional.name: Chinese Business Society

Pre-Professional.desc: Delta Sigma Pi is a professional fraternity organized to foster the study of business in universities; to encourage scholarship, social activity and the association of students for their mutual advancement by research and practice; to promote closer affiliation between the commercial world and students of commerce, and to further a higher standard of commercial ethics and culture and the civic and commercial welfare of the community.
Pre-Professional.name: Delta Sigma Pi

Pre-Professional.desc: To create and foster an interdisciplinary community of human-centered design-minded students, including those interested in Cognitive Science, User Experience, Interaction Design, Human Computer Interaction, Ubiquitous Computing, and Design Thinking in general. To provide workshops, lectures, a design space, support for design competition entries, networking opportunities, and real-world projects for those interested in the aforementioned fields; to be a vehicle to propel students in the direction of their respective goals, whether they be to enter industry, pursue academia, or to just learn more about design; and to forge/maintain connections with alumni, local communities, and companies.
Pre-Professional.name: Design at UCSD

Pre-Professional.desc:
ESW-UCSD’s Vision: We envision a worldwide era of sustainability in which all communities cooperate to achieve lasting environmental, social, and economic prosperity.
 
ESW-UCSD’s Mission: Our mission is to bring communities together to develop, implement, and share sustainable technologies and practices worldwide.
Pre-Professional.name: Engineers for a Sustainable World

Pre-Professional.desc: Engineers Without Borders--UCSD Chapter is a non-profit organization dedicated to the betterment of developing communities around the world through the design, implementation, and construction of sustainable projects that fit the need of the community. Our goal is to establish an on-going relationship with these developing communities and to teach them the necessary skills to maintain the facilities and structures that we leave them with.
Pre-Professional.name: Engineers Without Borders at UCSD

Pre-Professional.desc: The purpose of the UC San Diego Entrepreneur Challenge is to encourage the development of promising ideas and technologies into value generating enterprises. The competition brings together multi-disciplinary teams of engineers, scientists, and business-minded students with local area entrepreneurs and professionals.
Pre-Professional.name: Entrepreneur Challenge

Pre-Professional.desc:
To connect students to career enhancing opportunities in academia and
industry and nurture their development into respectable, professional
engineers.
Pre-Professional.name: Eta Kappa Nu

Pre-Professional.desc: Build UC San Diego's presence within the industry of high finance through mentorships with established alumni.
Pre-Professional.name: Financial Professionals Network

Pre-Professional.desc: Mission Statement: To bring business and education together in a positive working relationship through innovative leadership and career development programs.
Pre-Professional.name: Future Business Leaders of America - Phi Beta Lambda

Pre-Professional.desc: Global China Connection (GCC) recognizes the increasing integration of economies and communication worldwide, especially in America and China. We hope to not only educate our peers to be aware of these increasing ties but also promote the cooperation between these different cultures. Moreover, we want to introduce opportunities for American and Chinese students to jointly experience and explore the vast possibilities of collaboration between the super powers of the world.
Pre-Professional.name: Global China Connection

Pre-Professional.desc: Global Medical Brigades (GMB) is a secular, international network of university clubs that travel to developing countries to perform health care in communities without access to medicine otherwise. GMB delivers a holistic model for sustainable health through rigorous needs assessments, sponsoring referrals to those with needs beyond our capacity, keeping accurate electronic patient records, and working to improve the water and overall public health infrastructures of the villages we serve.
Pre-Professional.name: Global Medical Brigades

Pre-Professional.desc: The HMP3 Peer Mentor Program is designed to provide its members with unique community service opportunities, career advice and insight, and valuable mentoring experiences. It is meant to foster professional relationships that will lead to academic and career-based success. This cooperation amongst undergraduate peers will eventually lead to a greater solidarity and intellectual camaraderie in the UCSD community.
Pre-Professional.name: HMP3 Peer Mentor Program

Pre-Professional.desc: To build technical skills, professional skills, and social connections by applying engineering outside the classroom.
Pre-Professional.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineering (IEEE)

Pre-Professional.desc: Our purpose is to bring professional development to students in the pharmaceutical, biotechnological, and related industries. Thus our members will be offered resume/interview building workshops, networking events with industry professionals, industry tours, discussion panels, and much more.
Pre-Professional.name: International Society of Pharmaceutical Engineers (ISPE)

Pre-Professional.desc: To increase the number of culturally responsible black engineers who succeed academically, excel professionally and positively impact the community.
Pre-Professional.name: National Society of Black Engineers

Pre-Professional.desc: The National Society of Leadership and Success, Sigma Alpha Pi, is a leadership honor society. As an organization dedicated to building leaders who make a better world, the Society is a community where like-minded, success-oriented individuals come together to learn from and support one another. The Society was founded on the core belief that we accomplish more together than we would achieve alone. Members are provided with professional leadership training, helping them achieve their goals and gain a competitive edge in the employment market.
Pre-Professional.name: National Society of Leadership and Success

Pre-Professional.desc:
Pre-Professional Fraternity (pre-law).

The purpose of this Fraternity shall be to form a strong bond uniting students and teachers of the law with members of the Bench and Bar in a fraternal fellowship designed to advance the ideals of liberty and equal justice under law; to stimulate excellence in scholarship; to inspire the virtues of compassion and courage; to foster integrity and professional competence; and to promote the welfare of its members.
Pre-Professional.name: Phi Alpha Delta

Pre-Professional.desc: To prepare our members for a career in health and to promote fraternity amongst our members
Pre-Professional.name: Phi Delta Epsilon

Pre-Professional.desc: UCSD’s Pre-Law Society is a non-profit organization. It’s purpose is to give its members a wide variety of information as well as offer resources for students interested in attending law school. The officers of this organization are chosen both through an election and appointment process by current officers; they are chosen based on their leadership abilities and desire to further the organization. The organization also hold’s a minimum of one formalized meeting a quarter, with the potential for
Pre-Professional.name: Pre Law Society

Pre-Professional.desc: Pre-Pharmacy Society is an organization that promotes the career of pharmacy through a variety of resources that include workshops, volunteer opportunities, guest speakers, and networking to compliment the interests of our members. Our main objectives are to better prepare our members for pharmacy school admission and to learn and explore the multitude of career options for pharmacists. While providing essential information to our members, PPS also strives to make the club as fun as possible for our members.
Pre-Professional.name: Pre-Pharmacy Society (PPS)

Pre-Professional.desc: This non-profit organization is dedicated to introducing the idea to veterinary medicine to interested students, providing peer networking and support for pre-veterinary students, and to offer opportunities to gain experience in the veterinary field. To guide pre-veterinary students and help them make informed decisions about their goals in the field of veterinary medicine.
Pre-Professional.name: Pre-Veterinary Student Association at UCSD (PVSA)

Pre-Professional.desc: The purpose of our group is to build a network amongst the graduate students within the Chemistry and Biochemistry Department to foster professional development and to address issues that affect women in the fields of chemistry and biochemistry. We aim to generate constructive discussion on various topics such as career planning and professional negotiation tactics, as well as personal issues such as staying motivated and addressing grievances. We also aim to positively impact graduate student well-being by providing encouragement and emotional support and by advising fellow students on practical matters related to their current work.
Pre-Professional.name: Society for Women in Graduate Studies in Chemistry and Biochemistry

Pre-Professional.desc:
The Chapter is committed to preparing members for success in the global business world, celebrating diversity, and contributing back to the community.

The objectives and goals of the Chapter shall be to:
1. Support and develop programs that provide for the advancement of Asian heritage scientists and engineers. This goal shall be implemented by:
    -Career Workshops
    -Seminars and Symposia that focus on bettering the employability of members by bolstering the soft skills of members, working on their resumes, and teaching interview skills.
2. Develop and support programs that aid Asian heritage scientists and engineers who are actively seeking careers.
    -Interactions with potential employers
    -Tutoring/Curriculum assistance
    -Mentoring programs
3. Provide a forum for professional development and for the connection with entrepreneurial opportunities.
4. Inform the public of contributions and advancement made by Asian heritage scientists and engineers in newsletters and awards ceremonies.
Pre-Professional.name: Society of Asian Scientists & Engineers at UCSD

Pre-Professional.desc:
To equip up and coming engineers and entrepreneurs with fundamental skills in: design, design for manufacture, data acquisition, cost reduction, cost-benefit analysis, project management, technical writing, marketing, and communication through the lens of building a formula style race car.

The FSAE competition itself involves the design and development of a proposed prototype formula style race car that is then taken to one or more of the nine international events hosted by SAE International to be raced against universities from around the world. The multi-faceted competition is composed of static and dynamic events and truly challenges students to meet the grueling demands of the project overall.
Pre-Professional.name: Society of Automotive Engineers

Pre-Professional.desc: This Society is established for the following purpose: To supplement the engineering education of University of California, San Diego students, to promote the personal and professional development of its members, and to improve the community of which we are part through outreach and community service.
Pre-Professional.name: Society of Civil and Structural Engineers

Pre-Professional.desc:
Mission

SHPE changes lives by empowering the Hispanic community to realize their fullest potential and impacts the world through STEM awareness, access, support and development.

Vision

SHPE's vision is a world where Hispanics are highly valued and influential as the leading innovators, scientists, mathematicians and engineers.
Pre-Professional.name: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers

Pre-Professional.desc: To promote women in engineering and STEM fields.
Pre-Professional.name: Society of Women Engineers (SWE)

Pre-Professional.desc: Student Society for Medical Ethics serves as a forum for members of the UCSD community to discuss current and historical issues in biomedical ethics. Undergraduate and graduate medical students and others interested discuss ethical challenges, investigate the history and literature of medicine, and foster student-faculty interactions. SSME provides students, faculty and staff with an opportunity to present clinical case studies and engage their peers in fruitful discourse.
Pre-Professional.name: Student Society for Medical Ethics

Pre-Professional.desc:
SEDS is an independent, student-based organization which promotes the exploration and development of space.
SEDS believes in a space-faring civilization and that focusing the enthusiasm of young people is the key to our future in space.
Pre-Professional.name: Students for the Exploration and Development of Space

Pre-Professional.desc: Teachers 4 change is an EDS graduate student organization that aims to bridge the multiple subject and single subject cohorts in order to build social and professional networks.
Pre-Professional.name: Teachers 4 Change: EDS Graduate Student Organization

Pre-Professional.desc: The purpose of Theta Tau is to build a strong fraternal bond and maintain high standards of professionalism among fellow members. Theta Tau aims to provide its members the social and professional development necessary to succeed during and after their college years.
Pre-Professional.name: Theta Tau

Pre-Professional.desc: To create business leaders in the UCSD community by engaging students in the consulting sector with real-life applications and professional development.
Pre-Professional.name: Triton Consulting Group
Triton Engineering Student Council

Pre-Professional.desc:
(formerly Pathways Ventures) 
get inspired. get started. get BIG.
Pre-Professional.name: Triton Entrepreneurs

Pre-Professional.desc: To promote UCSD's accounting program and provide career insight and opportunities for prospective undergraduate students.
Pre-Professional.name: Undergraduate Accounting Society

Pre-Professional.desc: Undergraduate Business Network is a pre-professional student organization that strives to be a resource for undergraduate students who are interested in the field of business. By providing mentorship, networking opportunities, and workshops for essential business skills, UBN offers valuable career development at the University of California, San Diego. Despite the diverse set of majors and career goals that members pursue, the organization consists of driven individuals who are united by a common interest in business. UBN is a non-profit student organization.
Pre-Professional.name: Undergraduate Business Network (formerly Undergraduate Business Association)

Pre-Professional.desc: The Undergraduate Communication Society (UCS) is an organization run by and for students interested in communication. The UCS conducts career panels, field trips  (in which we are not responsible for member's transportation and utilize public transportation throughout San Diego) and social events for members, often including alumni and guest speakers from the communication field.
Pre-Professional.name: Undergraduate Communication Society at UCSD

Pre-Professional.desc: To empower students with financial knowledge.
Pre-Professional.name: Undergraduate Investment Society

Pre-Professional.desc: WIC is a non-profit student organization committed to fostering a supportive and informative environment for women in the Computer Science and Engineering department through technical, professional development, and social events. We also focus on high school outreach programs to bring more young women into the field. Keynote speakers, career fair information, interview preparation, and awareness about relevant CS conferences are few of the opportunities that will be provided for our members.
Pre-Professional.name: Undergraduate Women in Computing at UCSD

Pre-Professional.desc: UNISEM is a non-political, non-religious, non-profit organization focused on the following mission: As a student organization geared towards preparing students in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics for success in their future careers, UNISEM’s goal is to provide stimulating leadership, intellectual, and real life work opportunities by intertwining all STEM disciplines.
Pre-Professional.name: United Scientists, Engineers, and Mathematicians (UNISEM)

Pre-Professional.desc: To transform students of UC San Diego into sustainable professionals by providing practical experiences and developing behaviors leading to a sustainable campus, nation, and world.
Pre-Professional.name: USGBC Student Group

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Damar

Service.desc: To create globally conscious active citizens who commit to lifelong service, Alternative Breaks organizes local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Empower Hour

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are national or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with quality direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work in.
Service.name: AB Hearts for Homes

Service.desc: To send students on local, national, or international service-learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities that they work alongside.
Service.name: AB HKO

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Homecoming

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB iEMPOWER

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB ISCO

Service.desc: Our trip focuses on the issues of mental health/illness, youth empowerment and education. We hope to help at-risk or mentally ill children be inspired, empowered and discover their own potential through providing the educational tools and meeting the mental health needs of these children and their families. Through this, we hope to pave the way for these children in becoming confident and contributing members of society. We are passionate about this type of service because there are a lot of misconceptions associated with children raised in at-risk families and the mental health disorders they may suffer from. We hope to learn more about these issues to help spread awareness and change the stigma associated with children from these backgrounds.
Service.name: AB Niles

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Peace

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Project Appalachia

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Project Sustain

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Rhodes Homes

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Snowbird

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are national or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with strong direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work alongside.
Service.name: AB Vida Medica

Service.desc:
Working under the Alternative Break collaborative to help inspire and train students to be active citizens. We are working to prepare and implement a service-learning trip to Belize focusing on the social justice issues of youth development, education, and health.

Throughout the year we as an organization will help educate not only our group but those interested in the issues that we are planning to progress. Through community service, seminars, fundraisers, and other activities we hope to ready ourselves and obtain the necessary resources we will need to succeed on our trip and make a sustainable impact on the community we will be working with.
Service.name: AB YOU

Service.desc: Alternative Weekends inspire and connect the UCSD community to the SD surrounds through active awareness and education of a wide range of social justice issues.
Service.name: AB@UCSD: Alternative Weekends

Service.desc: Alpha Phi Omega is a co-ed service fraternity organized to provide community service, leadership and social opportunities to college students. The purpose of this fraternity is to assemble college students in a national service fraternity in the fellowship of principles derived from the Scout Oath and Law of the Boy Scouts of America; to develop leadership, to promote friendship and to provide service to humanity; and to further freedom that is our national, educational and intellectual heritage
Service.name: Alpha Phi Omega

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are national or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with quality direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work in.
Service.name: Alternative Breaks Executive Board

Service.desc: Alternative Breaks are local, domestic, or international service learning trips that use education of social justice issues combined with quality direct service to have a lasting impact on students and the communities they work in.
Service.name: Alternative Breaks@UCSD

Service.desc: The purpose of our organization is correlate, make connections, with bigger medical volunteering organizations on and off campus to provide antibiotics for developing countries. The organization will establish domestic and international relatioships, and will mainly focus on fundraising for antibiotics. People from other countries die by the day because they lack simple over the counter antibiotics, and we would like to make a difference to this tragic situation.
Service.name: Antibiotics For Lives

Service.desc: The primary purpose of the organization is to organize and operate charity basketball games to raise money for blind organizations.
Service.name: Ballers for the Blind

Service.desc: The Bhagat Puran Singh Health Initiative aims to eliminate health and social misconceptions within underserved and underprivileged populations by providing access to health education and free health clinics for the betterment of the body.
Service.name: Bhagat Puran Singh Health Initiative (BPSHI)

Service.desc: Helping underprivileged kids go to camp.
Service.name: Camp Dragonfly

Service.desc: To provide a free summer camp to children ages 6-18 who have/had a parent with cancer.
Service.name: Camp Kesem

Service.desc: CHERUBS at UCSD is a non-profit student organization. We are supported by CHERUBS, a national organization that was created to make sure that no family endures Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia without support or accurate information.  CHERUBS stands for Congenital Diaphragmatic Hernia Awareness, Support, and Birth Defect Research. Cherubs are a term within the support community for babies who are affected by congenital diaphragmatic hernias, or CDH. Our mission is to further the mission of CHERUBS the national organization by raising awareness of the affliction and raising funds for supporting families and medical research.
Service.name: CHERUBS at UCSD

Service.desc: Circle K International is comprised of university students who are responsible citizens and leaders with a lifelong commitment to community service worldwide. Through the three tenets of Service, Leadership, and Fellowship, Circle K inspires people to better our world, following the motto of "Live to Serve, Love to Serve." Circle K provides constructive opportunities for students to become involved on their campuses and communities through service work to others in need.
Service.name: Circle K. International

Service.desc: The purpose of Coaching Corps is to provide volunteers to coach sports at low resource communities.
Service.name: Coaching Corps

Service.desc: Colleges Against Cancer is a non-profit nationwide collaboration of college students, faculty, and staff dedicated to eliminating cancer by initiating and supporting programs for cancer education in college communities. We accomplish this through our four strategic directions: Cancer Education, Advocacy, Relay For Life, and Survivorship.
Service.name: Colleges Against Cancer

Service.desc: The purpose of this organization is to bring students together to help prevent and combat Human Trafficking. We will have weekly meetings, come up with ideas, and volunteer with non-governmental organizations to help make a difference.
Service.name: Combating Human Trafficking Organization at UCSD

Service.desc: This is a grassroots project. It is a project by people, for people. The aim is to foster hope, health and opportunity in communities across this crazy, lopsided globe. It is predicated on the radical notion that what matters in life is not profit but relationships, connection, warmth, laughter, empathy and a sense of purpose, self-efficacy and meaning.
Service.name: Community Hope Project

Service.desc:
CORDUSA@UCSD is a non-profit undergraduate student service organization that strives to get the UCSD community involved in furthering the vision of an Indian NGO called Chinmaya Organization for Rural Development(CORD) in order to uphold the welfare of the communities it serves. All efforts, initiatives and aspirations of CORDUSA@UCSD are oriented towards two main purposes:
1) The channeling of awareness and involvement of UCSD students towards forming creative and inventive methods of furthering the presence of CORD and CORDUSA in San Diego as well as towards forming their own initiative to implement within CORD centers abroad.
2) Consistently ensuring that our project is focused towards promoting the CORD standard of maximum productivity, empowerment, and growth within the context of its implementation.
Service.name: CORDUSA at UCSD

Service.desc:
The purpose of this organization is to engage and empower students and the
 community to heighten social awareness by raising funds in a creative, energetic, and fun manner to benefit Rady Children’s Hospital - the largest children's hospital in California. The organization aims to provide students from the University of California San Diego an opportunity to take part in community service and philanthropic events while learning new skills and developing lasting friendships.
Service.name: Dance Marathon at UCSD

Service.desc: Interdisciplinary teams creating local and social impact through human-centered design
Service.name: Design for America

Service.desc: To recruit and train UCSD students to serve as volunteer tutors and mentors to K-12 students in San Diego communities that are underserved. This program aims to establish and maintain partnerships with local schools and community based organizations. We seek to promote a college-going culture, better attitudes toward school, and an increase in academic performance.
Service.name: EducationCorps

Service.desc: Engineering World Health designs, provides, and maintains appropriate medical technology for developing nations. We accept students from all majors and walks of life who share our passion for improving global healthcare.
Service.name: Engineering World Health

Service.desc: Flying Sams is a medical service club at the University of California, San Diego in association with the non-profit service organization, The Flying Samaritans Inc. We are dedicated to providing free medical services to the underprivileged people of Mexico through a clinic staffed entirely of volunteer physicians, nurses, medical and pre-medical students.
Service.name: Flying Sams

Service.desc: FIMRC @ UCSD is one of many FIMRC Chapters across the nation determined to aid in the plight of children around the world. We are a non-profit organization dedicated to raising money for children who have limited access to health care as well as provide student voluntary assistance in various FIMRC clinics in underdeveloped countries.
Service.name: Foundation for International Medical Relief of Children (FIMRC) at UCSD

Service.desc: Fronteras Saludables (Healthier Borders) is student organization that hopes to spread awareness about health issues in Tijuana, Mexico. We will support the efforts of the HFiT free clinic (located in Mexico) through fundraising for medical supplies, medications, and other equipment. Fronteras Saludables (Healthier Borders) will inform UCSD undergraduates about opportunities to get involved in the HFIT internship program and other supporting roles.
Service.name: Fronteras Saludables (Healthier Borders)

Service.desc: This club exists to lower national blood pressure through individual and community involvement. Individual members will use the American Heart Association's Check. Change. Control program to mentor participants on high blood pressure and to encourage them to visit a medical professional and follow their advice. Various community events will help raise awareness of hypertension to a large range of ages and demographics.
Service.name: GenHealth Legacy at UCSD

Service.desc:
In alignment with Girl Up and the United Nations Foundation’s mission, the Girl Up club at UC San Diego aims to empower others to get involved, teach their communities that girls matter and make sure that girls in developing countries are educated, healthy, safe, counted and positioned to be the next generation of leaders.
Girl Up is an innovative campaign of the United Nations Foundation. We give American girls the opportunity to become global leaders and channel their energy and compassion to raise awareness and funds for the United Nations programs that help some of the world’s hardest-to- reach adolescent girls.
Service.name: Girl Up at UCSD

Service.desc: Global Brigades offers 7-10 day Engineering Brigades throughout the year in Honduras and Ghana. Engineering Brigades volunteers work with local engineers, technicians and community members to assess water problems and select feasible solutions. During the brigade, volunteers have the opportunity to assess potential water sources, map and survey community land, plan and design water projects, and provide technical follow-up on completed systems. Evenings consist of on-brigade education, where brigaders learn about community and project development, water sources, water system design and materials, data analysis, and project proposals. Volunteers will directly apply these engineering concepts during the brigade and have the opportunity to present summaries of their findings to the community. Construction of the water projects is a result of the collaboration between the Engineering and Water Brigades teams, Water Brigades volunteers, and community members. Together, Engineering and Water Brigades establish sustainable water systems, provide community education on water-related health issues, and empower community leaders to maintain the system. Between brigades, Global Brigades in-country staff maintains relationships with community leadership committees and provides follow-up with water systems.
Service.name: Global Engineering Brigades

Service.desc:
Global Medical Training (GMT) is an international, non-profit, and humanitarian organization that provides free medical, dental, and veterinary services in developing communities in parts of Central America and Mexico. Students are given the unique chance to directly participate in “hands-on” diagnoses and treatments under the supervision of medical professionals. This is the reason why our motto is “LEARN BY DOING.”
As a health-focused organization, our main purpose is to increase awareness of the lack of healthcare in third world countries by giving undergraduate students the chance to expand their understanding of life and medicine outside the United States. This is made possible by educating and exposing students to the prevalent global and medical issues that many underserved communities in developing countries face. Such issues include poverty, poor national health-care systems, and the various circumstances that contribute to and perpetuate a specific population’s situation.
GMT also understands there are major health issues that reside right in our own community. It is this very reason why we also offer our students the opportunity to volunteer in various community service events including free health fairs servicing the underprivileged in the Los Angeles and surrounding counties.
Altogether, GMT views student volunteers as a vital force for change.  After all, they may be the next generation of health-care providers.
Service.name: Global Medical Training

Service.desc: To promote the principles of humanitarian engineering, enabling students to apply their knowledge to current world issues.
Service.name: Global TIES Ambassadors

Service.desc:
Our purpose is to make available to younger students (particularly elementary school students) a gateway into an interest for the arts. By taking pieces of classical music, writing stories based on them, and performing these stories as live skits, we introduce an integration of creative pursuits: music, writing, and theater. 

We also increase the prevalence of the arts by relating music to other academic studies. For example, we go to science fairs and talk about the physics of sound; we also plan to match famous pieces of literature (e.g. Shakespearean plays) to appropriate pieces of music literature (e.g. Romantic symphonies).
Service.name: Harmonic Motions

Service.desc: College students will conceptualize and implement Health Corps at UCSD, which will deliver meaningful community service focusing on the health services sector for the benefit of communities of San Diego County. Through collaborations with the UCSD School of Medicine, Health and Medical Professions Preparation Program (HMP3), Center for Student Involvement (CSI), faculty, staff, students, community healthcare providers and nonprofit organizations, Health Corps at UCSD will serve clients and local nonprofits. We will engage in community mapping and meet with local nonprofits to identify and develop health related community placements for UCSD student volunteers.
Service.name: Health Corps at UCSD

Service.desc: Our organization is a branch of HMP3 (Health and Medical Professions Preparation Program) that is concerned primarily with providing our members, students who are interested in medical or health-related professions, with opportunities to become involved in community service in the form of volunteering and fundraising events.
Service.name: HMP3 Service

Service.desc:
The purpose of The Homeless Charter is to hand out food to the homeless in San Diego.  The organization seeks to promote weekly service to the greater community of San Diego, unity within the student body of UCSD, and awareness on the issue on feeding/sheltering the homeless.  

The Homeless Charter is a non-profit student organization.
Service.name: Homeless Charter, The

Service.desc: Karmonize aims to create a marketplace of goodwill on the UCSD campus. Karmonize supplies students with tools that empower them to connect and share skills. Karmonize gives students a way to get involved with the community and volunteer with local orgs or peers.
Service.name: Karmonize

Service.desc:
Fundraising in order to help the poor in Vietnam, Little Saigon (Westminster, CA), and San Diego.

During our annual trip to Vietnam, we provide scholarships, school supplies, and toys to children.  We also help provide medical care, dental care, and surgeries to the poor.  In Little Saigon and San Diego, we run an annual health fair for those without insurance.
Service.name: M.E.M.O. at UCSD

Service.desc: MEDLIFE is a secular, volunteer-run global health organization whose mission is to help families achieve greater freedom from the constraints of poverty, empowering them to live healthier lives. Our patients did not choose to be poor, but they do choose to strive for a better life. MEDLIFE stands beside them in this pursuit. We seek to achieve this goal through partnering with motivated individuals from poor communities working to improve their access to MEDs: Medicine, Education and community Development. MEDLIFE believes access to quality healthcare, education and personal development are basic human rights. To this end, we commit all our resources to bring Medicine, Education and Development to Low Income Families Everywhere. Along with affiliate chapters, MEDLIFE raises money for medicine, education and community development projects for low-income families around the world; actively learns about and increases awareness of inequality in global healthcare; and works to promote the highest standard of MEDLIFE's goals and reputation within the community.
Service.name: MEDLIFE at UCSD

Service.desc: The mission of Mission Center of HOPE (MCOH) is a charity club that “changes lives by harnessing the compassion and commitment of dedicated staff and volunteers to deliver sustainable, high-impact, community-based services to the poor and needy,” in accordance with the operation methods of the non-profit organization HOPE Worldwide, which serves as a progenitor for MCOH.
Service.name: Mission Center of HOPE

Service.desc: Movement Exchange unites dance and service through its network of university chapters and international dance exchanges, and year-round dance programs.
Service.name: Movement Exchange

Service.desc: MDA at UCSD has four purposes. The first is to increase student involvement in the MDA community by recruiting students to participate in MDA sponsored events. The second is to raise awareness about the disorders covered under MDA. The third is to help students understand the research that is being carried out on these disorders and connect them to local opportunities to perform research on these disorders. The fourth is education, to educate students on the causes, symptoms, and available treat
Service.name: Muscular Dystrophy Association at UCSD

Service.desc: The purpose of MCS is to provide an opportunity for student musicians who are interested in community service to give back to the community through music. Students will be performing at the hospitals, nursing homes and other community centers in the San Diego county (with the permission of the individual institutions), and in turn will learn about the community and its members by using music as a medium.
Service.name: Musicians for Community Service

Service.desc: The purpose of the National Residence Hall Honorary is to serve and recognize individuals, groups, and programs on campus that contribute to the success of residential life at UC San Diego.
Service.name: National Residence Hall Honorary

Service.desc: We are an engineering team affiliated with the Global TIES program working to build an open source viral load diagnostics device for use in low resource communities.
Service.name: Open Viral Load

Service.desc: Academic Honors Society- The purpose of the Society shall be to recognize and reward superior academic achievement among undergraduate students in institutions of higher education, and to encourage community service and promote leadership skills and continued academic excellence amongst its members.
Service.name: Phi Sigma Theta National Honors Society

Service.desc: To educate student body about energy conservation and provide opportunities to get involved in energy-saving projects.
Service.name: PowerSave Campus

Service.desc: Project BELL is a dynamic initiative that strives to develop lifelong learners and active citizens who make a lasting impact in their neighborhoods, communities, and world at large by using education as a creative platform.
Service.name: Project BELL

Service.desc: A non-profit organization that aims to improve the quality of health care in Nicaragua, cultivate humanitarian traits in future professionals, and raise awareness of Nicaragua.
Service.name: Project Nicaragua

Service.desc: Project RISHI (Rural India Social and Health Improvement) is an organization that strives to improve the conditions of villagers in some of the most remote places in India. We aim to help these underprivileged people by raising money during the academic year and using that money to complete various projects in these areas. Projects will include medical initiatives, educational efforts, agricultural support and correction of social problems.
Service.name: Project RISHI

Service.desc: Public Health Brigades is a non-profit, student organization whose mission is to improve the infrastructure of the homes in the community, primarily in order to help prevent diseases/respiratory problems and to increase the overall health of the families in the community. The current country of emphasis is Honduras where the organization provides public health education and infrastructure in collaboration with Sociedad Amigos de los Niños, a private non-profit organization founded by Sister Maria Rosa Leggol. The PHB chapter at UCSD will participate in one brigade per academic year. The brigade will be 7~8 days long and take place during a school break. In addition, volunteers will work together to help prepare a health education presentation on a given health topic (ie. dental hygiene, etc.) for students in the local community.
Service.name: Public Health Brigades

Service.desc: To provide Red Cross related activities and service opportunities to the UCSD student body.
Service.name: Red Cross at UCSD

Service.desc: Refugee Connection's mission is to work with multiple refugee organizations in order to expand our volunteer services and benefit the San Diego refugee community as much as we can. We aim to provide a domestic option for Global Health majors and minors to complete their field experience through volunteering with the health needs of refugee populations. We also hope to partner with UCSD professors to incorporate refugee issues into the education of students. As our rebranded Refugee Connection organization at UCSD, we plan to host events to fundraise for different local refugee organizations, including the continuation of the Culture Cup soccer tournament.
Service.name: Refugee Connection

Service.desc: The purpose of Rotaract is to follow Rotary International's motto of "Service Above Self." We are devoted to organizing and participating in both local and international service events. In addition, we strive to prepare our members for the future by offering professional development, leadership, and networking opportunities.
Service.name: Rotaract Club at UCSD

Service.desc: To build a greener future for San Diego by planting gardens, conducting restoration work, working with schools, and performing education and outreach programs.
Service.name: San Diego Wildflower Project

Service.desc: The purpose of this organization is to unite all potential U.S.M.C. Officer Candidates that are attending University of California, San Diego. Students that are interested in earning their commission as a United States Marine Corps Officer can join and meet other fellow candidates.
Service.name: Semper Fi Society at UCSD

Service.desc: We are planning to have food selling events, mostly including snacks based on size, throughout UCSD academic year.
Service.name: Snack Club at UCSD

Service.desc: To provide fun supplemental classes and activities to underserved youth in San Diego.
Service.name: STEM for Kids

Service.desc: Our program focuses on breaking down the wall that separates the disabled from their non-disabled peers. It is unique in its unification of the peer-mentorship of young adults with mental and physical disabilities and their transitional community education. We mainly work with disabled students ages 18-22, and our current partners include the Transitional Resources for Adult Community Education (TRACE) department of the San Diego Unified School District and Include Autism. Our student volunteers serve as teachers that target three critical areas imperative to independent living: communication, health awareness, and vocational skills. They also serve as mentors who participate in recreational activities and field trips that supplement the student’s community education. Our program is open to all UCSD undergraduates who are interested in empowering and bonding with other students their age with a wide range of disabilities.
Service.name: StRIVE

Service.desc: To promote, facilitate and perpetuate the philanthropic spirit among the UCSD student community.
Service.name: Student Foundation

Service.desc: To encourage and foster social, recreational, and cultural growth and experiences in the spirit of diversity.
Service.name: Student Support Services Club (SSSC or SSS Club)

Service.desc: The Student Veteran Organization (SVO) at University of California, San Diego purpose is to coordinate campus activities, provide pre-professional networking, and generally provide a touchstone for student veterans in higher education. The SVO works to facilitate and organize events that benefit student veterans, the general student population, and members of our community, as well as connect veterans with resources both on and off of our campus.
Service.name: Student Veterans Organization

Service.desc: The Students for Food Justice is a public service founded organization that strives to raise awareness about food insecurity at UCSD, other UC campuses, and the San Diego community. We will be advocating for student services and policies that make the UCSD campus more food secure for its students. We will also raise awareness of food justice, it being that communities exercise their right to grow, sell, and eat healthy food, where healthy food is fresh, nutritious, affordable, culturally appropriate, and grown locally with care for the well-being of the land, workers and animals. We also will base our values on The Real Food Principle, which encompasses a concern for producers, consumers, communities, and the earth. We aim to partner with preexisting entities in order to create a network of advocacy and support, such as the Triton Food Pantry, the campus community gardens, and other well-being organizations. Support includes, but is not limited to food drives, helping with campus gardens, providing educational workshops on food security, food demonstrations, events to raise awareness of food insecurity and the actual meaning of food justice.
Service.name: Students for Food Justice

Service.desc: Surfrider Foundatioin UCSD club is a club that works to keep our local beaches and ocean clean, while also keeping our marine wildlife safe. Members promote a cleaner marine environment that students and faculty alike can enjoy, and inform students about current environmental issues.
Service.name: Surfrider Foundation Club at UCSD

Service.desc:
Swipes for the Homeless is an
international, 501(c)3 non-profit
organization consisting of a coalition of
university and college chapters located
throughout the world. Our dual mission is
to tangibly and tactically partner with
college campuses to alleviate hunger
while raising young people’s awareness
of homelessness and hunger through
education and outreach.
Service.name: Swipes for the Homeless

Service.desc: Through the production, "The Vagina Monologues," V-Day @ UCSD raises money and awareness to fight violence against women and girls.  We are a not-for-profit student-run community service organization.
Service.name: The Vagina Monologues V-Day @ UCSD

Service.desc: The purpose of Tritons for Community is to connect undergraduates at the University of California, San Diego, especially students majoring in the fields of Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics to volunteer opportunities and projects that will benefit the community of San Diego. Our goal is to help victims of human trafficking and homelessness through funding rehabilitation programs, safe houses, and other projects. We also volunteer and fund raise with existing organizations that share our goals.
Service.name: Tritons for Community

Service.desc: To educate, advocate, and fundraise on behalf of children and in support of UNICEF’s lifesaving work.
Service.name: Tritons for UNICEF

Service.desc: Tzu Chi Collegiate Association at UCSD is a non-profit student organization, which aims to inspire college-level students in the mindful practice of the Tzu Chi Foundation’s principles of Love, Respect, and Gratitude through service at the community level. Tzu Ching promote the universal value of “Great Love” through the Tzu Chi Foundation’s missions of Charity, Medicine, Education, Culture, International Relief, Bone Marrow Donation, Environmental Protection and Community Service. Through mindful practice of Founder Dharma Master Cheng Yen’s teachings, Tzu Ching hope to purify people's minds and bring positive influence into the community.
Service.name: Tzu Chi Collegiate Association at UCSD

Service.desc: Volunteers Around the World (VAW) is an NGO devoted to improving the standard	 of living for those that live in some of the most poverty stricken communities of the	 	world. Our focus is to provide communities with access to medical treatment,			medication, nutritional security, clean water, and health education. Our medical		outreach will provide volunteers with an opportunity to shadow medical			professionals and work side by side with experienced doctors in Latin America. Volunteers will fundraise and accumulate medicines prior to the trip to the host country. While in the country, volunteers will shadow and assist the doctors, perform triage, measure vital statistics, manage the pharmacy and teach public health classes, all under the direct supervision of experienced, local doctors.
Service.name: Volunteers Around the World at UCSD

Social.desc: Acamazing is a co-ed a cappella group which seeks to provide a fun and enriching environment for singers and aspiring singers to make music without the use of instruments. We aim to nurture the musical talent of UCSD students and to entertain ourselves, ?the UCSD community, and the general public. Additionally we hope that all members gain a better understanding of music and enrich their own musicality while building lasting friendships with their fellow members.
Social.name: Acamazing

Social.desc: Ambience Glove Lightshows at UCSD is dedicated to creating a safe and sober environment for people to learn, practice, and trade lightshows. However, Ambience is not just a club on campus; we are a movement. A movement for all the lightshow artists out there who love this form of art and want to see it become accepted in the performance art community. We are not here to make gloving mainstream, but rather to spread awareness and give people the opportunity to become more exposed to the culture.
Social.name: Ambience (formerly known as Light Show Shuffle Disco)

Social.desc:
The purpose of this club is to provide Army ROTC participants at UCSD a club where they may discuss Army training, job possibilities and work out together in order to foster 
a sense of unity with their ROTC peers.
Social.name: Army ROTC at UCSD

Social.desc: To provide a fun and lively atmosphere to continue our passion for a cappella music at the collegiate level; to immerse members into the a cappella community on-campus and beyond; to strengthen and improve vocal and musical ability; to provide entertaining performances; and to foster close-knit relationships within the group.
Social.name: Beat @ UCSD, The

Social.desc: A group for cue sport enthusiasts consisting mostly of students attending UCSD. A platform to organize meetups for casual games and set up tournaments, as well as learning the fundamentals of stroke techniques. All skill levels are welcome, and you'll come out with some new techniques to show your friends!
Social.name: Billiards Club at UCSD

Social.desc:
-Mission
The Biomedical Sciences Graduate Student Council (“The Council”) is a non-profit student group which represents the interests and concerns of BMS students.  The Council will strive to improve the overall quality of the BMS program by promoting a sense of community within the BMS student body; by facilitating communication between students and faculty; and by providing social, academic, and professional programming for BMS students.
 
-Goals
To represent and promote the academic, social, and professional aims of BMS students
To establish effective communication channels among BMS students, other student organizations, and with the academic and administrative units of the University
To serve as an advocate of BMS students needs, ensuring that their concerns are heard and addressed.
Social.name: Biomedical Sciences Graduate Student Council

Social.desc: We would like to introduce Jewish and non-Jewish students of legal drinking age to fermented beverages and teach them about the process that goes into making these beverages.
Social.name: Brews with Jews

Social.desc: The purpose of our club is to create a friendly environment where people can express their love of books and encourage to foster a similar love for reading throughout their community.
Social.name: Brilliantly Bookish

Social.desc: To present Japanese animation subtitled in English to Members of the club. We intend to engender a social atmosphere in which members can enjoy anime and learn about Japanese culture.
Social.name: Cal-Animage Beta

Social.desc: To promote service, academic development, leadership, and a sense of community among recipients of the UCSD Chancellor’s Scholarship through volunteer and community service opportunities, social events, and  organized meetings.
Social.name: Chancellor's Scholars Alliance

Social.desc: The purpose of this organization is to gather people who love Chinese food. We can share ideas about what we believe, we can learn cooking skills from each other, we can have dinner every weekend. And most of all, we can disseminate and promote Chinese culture to people who are not familiar with. I believe people who love Chinese food will have a good time here.
Social.name: Chinese Food Organization

Social.desc:
To provide service to Chinese International students. Such as airport pick ups.
 Help them to fit into American culture. We are going to provide a platform for Chinese students and American students to get to know each other and communicate better. I think it is important because all the other Chinese student Orgs are not doing such events for Chinese Students to fit into American Culture and UCSD campus life.
Social.name: Chinese Student Association

Social.desc: Our Chapter of the College Diabetes Network was founded for the purpose of connecting college students with and affected by Juvenile Diabetes in the hopes that these connections will create a support network which will enable students to fulfill their potential and limit the negative psychological and physical effects of Diabetes.
Social.name: College Diabetes Network at UCSD

Social.desc: The purpose of the club is to foster community between comic: creators, artists, writers, readers, and enthusiasts
Social.name: Comicbook Club at UCSD

Social.desc: To assist and serve aspiring business leaders by bridging the gap between faith, community, and business opportunities through connections.
Social.name: Cornerstone Community Consultants

Social.desc: To gather together all those interested in Science Fiction and Fantasy.
Social.name: Darkstar

Social.desc: To bring together and create an all-women's acappella group within the UCSD community. To provide students who are interested in acappella music an outlet through performances and/or a group to belong to.
Social.name: Daughters of Triton

Social.desc:
We the people of Delta Pepon Delta, in Order to consume a more perfect Melon, establish Enjoyment, insure satirical properties, provide for the common student, promote the improvement of GPAs, and secure the amusement of social interaction to ourselves and our members, do ordain and establish this Constitution for the social organization Delta Pepon Delta.
Delta Pepon Delta is a social student organization that will provide a positive setting for members to connect in a way that was previously only provided by formal fraternities and sororities.
Social.name: Delta Pepon Delta

Social.desc: To provide a supportive environment in which singers can enjoy and participate in musical activities, specifically vocally.
Social.name: Duly Noted

Social.desc: To engange in social activities and practice fighting video games.
Social.name: Fight Club

Social.desc:
We compete in the Intercollegiate circuit throughout the school year. One of our main goals is to qualify for Intercollegiate Nationals as a team. Each skater performs individually in the level and event of their choosing and the points they earn from podium placement get added to the UCSD cumulative team score. Intercollegiate competitions are a great place to have a fun time and meet skaters from other schools throughout the country. 

Our team is tight knit on and off the ice. Practices are largely self scheduled figure skating is a sport driven by individual motivation to improve. However, members often carpool to practice help one another with jumps, spins, and choreography.
Social.name: Figure Skating @ UCSD

Social.desc: Frequency is the only all-male a cappella group at the University of California, San Diego (UCSD). Founded in 2008 and completely student-run, Frequency has been committed to promote a cappella music, provide entertainment through public and private performances, foster long-term relationships with the a cappella community on and off-campus, and to provide its members with leadership opportunities.
Social.name: Frequency

Social.desc: To promote the growth of Go/Baduk/Weiqi at UCSD and to offer a safe and fun place to play Go/Baduk/Weiqi.
Social.name: Go/Baduk/Weqi Club

Social.desc: The Happiest Club on Earth at UCSDisney is a non-profit student organization.  We seek to celebrate the wonder and excitement that Disney has captured through stories, characters, songs, and experiences all over the world.  We want to celebrate the Disney heritage while being a small part of it’s future. We strive to bring a little “Disney magic” to the campus, and promote members to achieve their own personal dreams while also helping others’ dreams come true.  After all “Laughter is timeless, imagination has no age, and dreams are forever.” –Walt Disney
Social.name: Happiest Club on Earth at UCSDisney , The

Social.desc: Harmony Club aims to provide a platform for people to share the beauty of their cultures, faiths and philosophies. This club aims to create and develop positive social connections within and between disparate values and diverse communities in order to achieve mutual understanding, tolerance and enriching positive social atmosphere.
Social.name: Harmony Club

Social.desc: A musical saxophone group that convenes to play wonderful saxophone music.  Hopkins Sax Jam promotes personal musicianship, coordination, and unity.  This group performs inside and outside of UCSD.
Social.name: Hopkins Sax Jam

Social.desc: To allow students who are interested in learning difference pop dances and to participate and socialize with others sharing the same interests.
Social.name: IDYOSINCRASIE

Social.desc: As a car club at the University of California, San Diego, Imports@UCSD aims to build a community for car enthusiasts to gather and share their collective knowledge about automobiles and motor sports. Our goals include teaching members about various aspects of automotive knowledge while constructing a network to develop strong connections in the automotive industry. We also strive to create a safe environment where we can test and improve the performance of our cars as well as our driving skills. Highly discouraging street racing, Imports@UCSD gives members the opportunity to go to the race track to satisfy their high performance driving needs. Using all of these resources and connections, members of Imports@UCSD can become strong leaders who are extremely knowledgeable in the automotive field and enthusiastic about everything they do. Even the slightest passion for cars will not be overlooked and is all that one must posses to become a proud and capable member of Imports@UCSD.
Social.name: Imports@UCSD

Social.desc: ISPG is a student run organization which aims to give students confidence to start and work on projects outside the classroom. With discussions on leadership, idea sessions , project group workdays, and workshops,  members will gain technical skills and knowledge about designing and managing projects effectively.
Social.name: Innovative Student Project Groups

Social.desc: To plan social, cultural, and educational events for residents for all seven residential areas.
Social.name: Inter-College Residents' Association (ICRA)

Social.desc:
Intermission is a student-run, student-managed and student-directed music ensemble that aims to provide student composers with an opportunity to orchestrate, compose for,  and direct an ensemble, and for student performers, of all levels, who wish improve their performance techniques by learning from each other in a relaxed environment and perform music recreationally.  We are mainly a social group that seek to further our respective areas of interest while enjoying our time together performing in the ensemble.
Our pieces will range from classical chamber and orchestral music to video game and film music, all arranged for the specific ensemble and instruments at hand.
Social.name: Intermission

Social.desc: To promote camaraderie and a sense of community among recipients of the UCSD Jacobs School Scholarship.
Social.name: Jacobs School Scholars Society

Social.desc: The United Korean Athletes Association at University of California, San Diego is a nonprofit student organization that promotes healthy interactions among Korean students through the following measures: (1) promotion of athletic activities including but not limited to basketball, soccer, and even traditional Korean activities such as Ssireum (2) directly and indirectly assisting their needs in the purpose of aiding students' adaptation to the new environment. These two central measures will bring about a sense of unity within the organization and deliver comfort to entering freshmen and transfer students in the new university setting at UC San Diego. This independent student-run organization will hold many events for Korean students and will strive to merge the Korean international student society by creating connections that link numerous other Korean societies/organizations in other universities across the US in order to serve as an organization that provides wide networking opportunities and others derived from such invaluable opportunity.
Social.name: Korean Athletic Network (KAN)

Social.desc: This is official Korean Graduate Student Association at UCSD. We provide social networks to current UCSD students and our Alumni. We have regular group meetings for various activities such as new students welcoming party, end-of quarter parties and  additional various events. Especially, we invite and share the information with Korean corporations for having recruit events at San Diego area (including on-campus events) to provide opportunities to qualified UCSD students.
Social.name: Korean Graduate Student Association (KGSA)

Social.desc: Our club seeks to provide both a recreational, social, and competitive community for players of the game League of Legends within UCSD and the greater San Diego area. By providing an environment of social interaction, friendly competition, and in-game support, we seek to give all of our members a positive gaming experience and the competitive drive to succeed in any gaming or non-gaming endeavor.
Social.name: League of Tritons

Social.desc: LESC Journal Club at UCSD is a graduate student organization committed to the reading and evaluation of literature concerning energy storage, conversion, and more. LESC Journal Club at UCSD is a non-profit student organization. It is a social organization created for students who are interested in developing the depth and breadth of their knowledge of energy and its applications in the world. Students will be responsible for both presenting and discussing articles from a variety of science journals, news, and other media sources.
Social.name: LESC Journal Club at UCSD

Social.desc: a.	Manipulation/Misdirection is a social club at UCSD intended to gather artists of various skills and interests and host a platform with which club members and interact, discusses, demonstrate their knowledge, skills, and ideas. Manipulation/Misdirection is intended to be a casual club, mostly concerned with building the community and collecting knowledge of the literature than being competitive. The club also strives to spread the art to all new practitioners, fostering a community for fellow magicians and artist to learn and appreciate the prestige of magic. The club primarily focuses on close-up and card magic, but also welcomes other forms of magic like street magic and stage magic. Besides magic, the club is also associated with other skills related to magic, such as poker mechanics, manual dexterity, pick pocketing, lock picking and escapes, confidence tricks, proposition bets, social engineering, and mental misdirection. The ultimate goal of Manipulation/Misdirection is to build a community of magicians and other artists to promote and spread this art form to the surrounding communities.
Social.name: Manipulation/Misdirection

Social.desc: This group created the Marshall community garden, and is responsible for maintaining it. We will plant fruits and vegetables, host community events in the space, and create a welcoming environment for new and continuing Marshall students to come make new friends and learn about growing food.
Social.name: Marshall Community Garden Committee

Social.desc: The Muir Musical is a UCSD student organization that produces one completely student-run musical theatre production annually. Students from all six UCSD colleges are invited to participate in a full-scale Broadway production that marks the single musical theatre opportunity for UCSD students all year long.
Social.name: Muir Musical

Social.desc: Our purpose is to give an outlet for music lovers to share and express their passion for music, to allow musicians to collaborate and learn from one another, and to give musicians of all levels the experience of performing with others in front of an audience.
Social.name: Musicians' Club @ UCSD

Social.desc: This company’s motivation is to give a voice to local playwrights, especially those at UCSD. Our company is dedicated to helping playwrights from beginning to end: we offer constructive criticism, staged readings, and assistance to works in progress. We provide an open forum for new and experienced artists to develop their craft.

Spiritual.desc: Falun Dafa is an ancient meditation practice in the Buddha school tradition; at the core of the practice are the values of Truthfulness, Compassion and Forbearance, which act as a guide for daily life and practice. Through tranquil meditations and an emphasis on the elevation of one’s heart-mind character, Falun Dafa has brought health and well-being to more than 100 million people in 100 countries around the world. Falun Dafa is not a religion, there is no membership and is completely free of charge! It is a mind-body practice with a spiritual component that covers metaphysics, ethics and enlightenment. Through persistent practice one strives to achieve a state of selflessness, increased insight, inner purity, balance- true health and ultimately enlightenment. Since July 1999 the communist government of China has persecuted and enslaved millions of innocent people for practicing Falun Dafa and they comprise 65% of labor camps, detention centers and prisons across China for believing in Truth- Compassion- Forbearance. Evidence from acclaimed sources have proven tens of thousands of Falun Dafa practitioners to have been killed from live organ harvesting for China’s lucrative organ transplant market. So what do we, as an organization, do on campus? We meditate together and teach the exercises, promote cultural art events that revive traditional Chinese culture and raise awareness about the persecution and organ harvesting of Falun Dafa practitioners in China.
Spiritual.name: Falun Dafa

Student Affirmative Action Committee(SAA.desc: We, the students of University of California at San Diego (UCSD), come together to provide a forum to deal with the problems and concerns of UCSD Asian and Pacific-Islander (API) students, especially those deemed “underrepresented” by the Student Affirmative Action Committee (SAAC); to try and create an environment where issues such as those political, educational, cultural and social can be addressed; to increase awareness about our API history and heritage within the university and the community; to unite as a community resource to represent a common voice and thereby empower ourselves; and to serve as a support network for building bonds and addressing differences between students. The Asian and Pacific-Islander Student Alliance is a non-profit organization.

Student Affirmative Action Committee(SAA.desc: M.E.Ch.A. is a political voice for UCSD. It takes part in a series of political events through out the year, such as Raza Awareness Week. M.E.Ch.A. also honors many cultural holidays such as El dia de los Muertos and Las Posadas that occur in December; creating an atmosphere for social interaction. M.E.Ch.A. also strives in bridging the gap between High School and College by working directly with the youth of our community. This is accomplished through our annual Raza Youth Empowerment Conference, weekly outreach events, campus tours, overnight programs, and one on one mentoring. In realizing the importance of giving back to the community, we recognize that we are at UCSD to be successful students. We strive to build a community that is strong and united. The year is finalized with our Raza Graduation. Most importantly, throughout the year we build a strong network of people who are currently aware students, activists, and friends.

Student Affirmative Action Committee(SAA.desc: Queer and Trans* People of Color (QT*POC) at UCSD was established in 2000 by a group of Queer students of Color FED UP with racism in the queer community, and with homophobia and transphobia within cultural organizations. With this, at the core of QT*POC are our commitments to struggle and our commitments to activism. We recognize the intersections of our multiple, beautiful, and sometimes confusing identities, as well as the related intersections of social justice movements. We create a SPACE--a social, political, academic, and cultural environment--to enhance our members' entire self-being and holistic wellness.
Student Affirmative Action Committee(SAA.name: Queer and Trans* People of Color (QT*POC) at UCSD
